Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TD Thornton is a premier consulting firm specializing in project management and project controls solutions. Our strong onboarding and training program sets our people up for success. All are welcome to apply, especially those with engineering, construction management, business analytics, scheduling, and project management backgrounds and anyone who truly enjoys teamwork.

Job Overview
Sector: Electric Utilities,

Seniority: Mid-Level

Location: San Ramon, Bay Area, Hybrid

As a Data & Reporting Analyst for the IT department, you will support our electric utility client by developing meaningful data insights and delivering robust reporting solutions that inform strategic decisions. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you’ll gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets, transforming them into dynamic dashboards and reports in Excel and Power BI. You’ll proactively address reporting needs, engage with stakeholders, and play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions within the IT function. Additionally, you will guide junior consultants and manage small-scale projects, ensuring alignment with client specifications and standards.

Your Day-to-Day Activities:



Work with various stakeholders to understand business processes and discover reporting needs for the client
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, develop data models, design dashboards, and reports
Analyze complex data sets from multiple sources based on the business requirements
Gather, clean, analyze, and summarize data related to the Line of Business assigned
Build dynamic dashboards in Excel and Power BI depending on the clients’ needs
Present data/ report findings to managers and directors to aid in making business decisions
Proactively follows up on issues and initiatives for senior leaders to ensure successful resolution and implementation
Train and mentor entry to mid-level consultants
Manage projects from start to finish with minimum direction and supervision
Create and/or migrate existing reports to Power BI
Effectively plans and executes work on a small project; integrates all aspects, tracks, and ensures that work progresses are on schedule and meets the client’s specifications or required standards
Facilitates problem-solving sessions and workshops with a diverse set of business team members





You’ll be prepared for this job if you have…



Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of budget management, including forecasting and tracking actual expenses against projected budgets, ensuring financial targets are met
5 – 10 years of experience in Data Analytics
3+ years of building visualizations in Power BI
5+ years of experience with Excel





You’ll stand out if you have…



10+ years of Data Analytics experience
5+ years of Power BI experience
Problem-solving and Communication skills





Compensation & Benefits


A Competitive Base Salary
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
Health Savings Accounts (HSA's)
401(k) with a Company Match
Annual Bonus
Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible Spending Account





About TD Thornton
Since 2005, TD Thornton has been helping our clients bridge organizational gaps by providing best-in-class consulting services and staff augmentation. Whether we are part of the contractor’s team or serving as an owner’s representative, we offer a wide spectrum of construction management support services to help our clients mitigate risks and deliver successful project outcomes. We believe our diversity is part of our strength and are proud to be a woman–owned and minority-owned company.

Learn more about us at www.tdthornton.com and on LinkedIn.

By providing your mobile number and opting in via our registration form, you consent to receive text messages (SMS) from TD Thornton.

Terms Of Service - TD Thornton

Privacy Policy - TD Thornton

HTML:
TD Thornton is a premier consulting firm specializing in project management and project controls solutions. Our strong onboarding and training program sets our people up for success. All are welcome to apply, especially those with engineering, construction management, business analytics, scheduling, and project management backgrounds and anyone who truly enjoys teamwork.

Job Overview
Sector: Electric Utilities,

Seniority: Mid-Level

Location: San Ramon, Bay Area, Hybrid

As a Data & Reporting Analyst for the IT department, you will support our electric utility client by developing meaningful data insights and delivering robust reporting solutions that inform strategic decisions. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you’ll gather, analyze, and interpret complex data sets, transforming them into dynamic dashboards and reports in Excel and Power BI. You’ll proactively address reporting needs, engage with stakeholders, and play a critical role in driving data-informed decisions within the IT function. Additionally, you will guide junior consultants and manage small-scale projects, ensuring alignment with client specifications and standards.

Your Day-to-Day Activities:


  • Work with various stakeholders to understand business processes and discover reporting needs for the client
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, develop data models, design dashboards, and reports
  • Analyze complex data sets from multiple sources based on the business requirements
  • Gather, clean, analyze, and summarize data related to the Line of Business assigned
  • Build dynamic dashboards in Excel and Power BI depending on the clients’ needs
  • Present data/ report findings to managers and directors to aid in making business decisions
  • Proactively follows up on issues and initiatives for senior leaders to ensure successful resolution and implementation
  • Train and mentor entry to mid-level consultants
  • Manage projects from start to finish with minimum direction and supervision
  • Create and/or migrate existing reports to Power BI
  • Effectively plans and executes work on a small project; integrates all aspects, tracks, and ensures that work progresses are on schedule and meets the client’s specifications or required standards
  • Facilitates problem-solving sessions and workshops with a diverse set of business team members




You’ll be prepared for this job if you have…


  • Financial Acumen: Strong understanding of budget management, including forecasting and tracking actual expenses against projected budgets, ensuring financial targets are met
  • 5 – 10 years of experience in Data Analytics
  • 3+ years of building visualizations in Power BI
  • 5+ years of experience with Excel




You’ll stand out if you have…


  • 10+ years of Data Analytics experience
  • 5+ years of Power BI experience
  • Problem-solving and Communication skills




Compensation & Benefits

  • A Competitive Base Salary
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
  • Health Savings Accounts (HSA's)
  • 401(k) with a Company Match
  • Annual Bonus
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Flexible Spending Account




About TD Thornton
Since 2005, TD Thornton has been helping our clients bridge organizational gaps by providing best-in-class consulting services and staff augmentation. Whether we are part of the contractor’s team or serving as an owner’s representative, we offer a wide spectrum of construction management support services to help our clients mitigate risks and deliver successful project outcomes. We believe our diversity is part of our strength and are proud to be a woman–owned and minority-owned company.

Learn more about us at www.tdthornton.com and on LinkedIn.

By providing your mobile number and opting in via our registration form, you consent to receive text messages (SMS) from TD Thornton.

Terms Of Service - TD Thornton

Privacy Policy - TD Thornton

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Objetivo principal:

El candidato ideal será capaz de interpretar y analizar datos complejos para ayudar a la empresa a tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Este individuo también deberá tener un fuerte sentido de la iniciativa, capacidad para comunicarse de manera efectiva y un profundo entendimiento del negocio y el producto.




¿Qué harás?

Realizar análisis de datos complejos e interpretar resultados.
Utilizar plataformas de nube para almacenamiento y análisis de datos.
Crear y optimizar modelos matemáticos para mejorar la toma de decisiones.
Dominar las bibliotecas de R y Python para el análisis de datos.
Comunicar resultados de análisis de datos de manera efectiva, a través de narrativas claras y concisas (storytelling).
Presentar hallazgos y entender las necesidades del negocio y el producto.
Uso de herramientas ETL, preferentemente Dataiku.




¿A quién buscamos?

Experiencia de 3 a 4 años en roles similares.
Licenciatura en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o afin.
Experiencia en análisis de datos y modelado matemático.
Dominio de las bibliotecas de R y Python.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ETL, preferentemente Dataiku.
Inglés intermedio.
Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y presentación.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y de forma independiente.
Comprensión profunda del negocio y el producto.
Experiencia en la utilización de software de visualización de datos como Tableau o Power BI sería una ventaja.
Habilidades en comunicación, trabajo en equipo, negociación, organización, solución de problemas.




“En Walmart de México y Centroamérica estamos comprometidos con una cultura de Pertenencia, por lo que buscamos incorporar el mejor talento basándonos en competencias, habilidades y potencial; no discriminamos por ningún motivo, incluyendo género, edad, origen étnico, apariencia física, estado civil, estado de salud, situación socioeconómica, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género por ello durante el proceso de atracción y selección no solicitaremos información personal, fotografías o análisis clínicos de ningún tipo. Consideramos que los datos personales del candidato o candidata no son relevantes durante el proceso de entrevista ni para la selección final. En Walmart de México y Centroamérica nos comprometemos con nuestros asociados que encuentren día a día en el trabajo un ambiente de respeto, dónde es libre de discriminación y acoso sexual.”

Title: Data & Insights Analyst (NYC)
Description:
About Us

Scaler is an action-focused sustainability platform purpose-built for the real estate industry. We empower real estate managers and investors to protect value, improve resiliency, and reduce long-term risk.

Role Overview

We’re looking for a detail-oriented Data & Insights Analyst with a strong analytical background and an interest in sustainability and real estate. In this role, you’ll manage and analyze large datasets, ensure data accuracy within our platform, and help translate insights into clear, actionable narratives for internal teams and C-level clients. Ideal candidates will be skilled in Excel, comfortable working with data, and eager to contribute to meaningful client interactions. SQL experience is a plus.

Responsibilities:


Assist in managing and interpreting large datasets related to sustainability reporting and real estate performance
Ensure accurate data entry, validation, and organization within Scaler’s proprietary platform
Support sustainability data collection and analysis workflows, helping to streamline and improve internal processes
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to uphold data integrity and recommend process enhancements
Conduct research on industry trends and regulatory changes; contribute to internal reports and client-ready presentations
Assist in creating onboarding materials, internal documentation, and other operational support resources.


Requirements:


Currently in the final year of, or recently completed, a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Sustainability, Finance, Data Science, or a related field
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheet
Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail
Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communication skills
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Familiarity with sustainability concepts, real estate data is a plus


Benefits


We offer a hybrid work policy: 2 days working from home and 3 days in-office each week
Opportunities to work closely with founders and leadership, providing mentorship and a deep understanding of startup operations.
Work closely with a diverse and passionate team that values innovation, creativity, and problem-solving


Why Scaler?

When you join Scaler, you will collaborate with a team of curious, sharp, supportive, and genuinely enthusiastic individuals about Scaler's product and unique value. Our people are committed to making a positive impact on our customers' journey to achieving absolute zero carbon.

Compensation Range: $75K - $115K

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Terrabis is a leading privately held cannabis company with a bold growth strategy. Operating in both wholesale and retail, we’re at the forefront of the industry, setting new standards, and pushing boundaries. Join us in shaping the future of cannabis.

Position Summary

Terrabis is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to drive insights, with a strong emphasis on business, customer and marketing analytics. This role will build and maintain dashboards to monitor business performance, customer behavior, marketing performance, and operational KPIs, while enabling stakeholders to make data-driven decisions. Additionally, this role will ensure data integrity through data pipeline monitoring and data enrichment through enhancing quality, value, and usability of data.

Responsibilities

Customer and Marketing Analytics


Partner with the marketing team to deliver customer data insights that enable deeper personalization across CRM, website, and other marketing channels.
Support the development and execution of test plans, campaign strategies, and post-campaign analyses to measure marketing effectiveness and drive continuous optimization.


Reporting and Dashboard Development


Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards to support business functions including Purchasing, Marketing, Retail Operations, and Accounting.
Enable business teams to track and monitor KPIs effectively by delivering accurate and timely reporting solutions.
Drive the adoption of self-service analytics by developing intuitive data visualization tools and empowering teams to generate their own insights.


Ad Hoc Analysis and Insights


Execute ad hoc analysis requests from cross-functional stakeholders and translate data findings into actionable business insights.
Support experimental design and analysis, including A/B tests, to validate strategies and inform decision-making.


Training and Enablement


Deliver training sessions and one-on-one coaching to internal stakeholders on analytics tools, dashboard usage, and data interpretation best practices.
Create clear documentation of data processes, reporting frameworks, and best practices to promote knowledge-sharing and organizational learning.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field.
2+ years of experience in working in data analytics or business intelligence including customer and marketing analytics.
Proficiency in writing SQL, Python, and other programming languages.
Experience in managing and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines and data integrations.
Proficiency in visualization tools such as Power BI and developing analytics dashboards.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Experience in a regulated industry, and Ecommerce (B2C) preferred.


Additional Information

Terrabis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics.

Data Analyst Pay Range: $90,000 USD - $100,000 USD

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Soleo is a thought leader in performance marketing and inbound lead generation. With over 20 years of digital marketing experience, we have earned our reputation by building world-class platforms, maintaining the highest standards of compliance, being selective about our suppliers, and providing best-in-class customer support.

The Opportunity

Our company is seeking a motivated and purposeful Data Analyst to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis, programming languages, and managing dashboards. The Data Analyst will develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive set of operational data capture methods, management reports, and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), thus providing an adequate set of tools for business planning and strategic decision making.

The analyst will also be responsible for highlighting performance issues and gaps, conducting root cause analysis, and facilitating performance optimization throughout the organization to meet defined targets for business performance and product quality. This role will also be responsible for the validation, timeliness, and accuracy of the data feeding performance reports, executive summaries, and KPI’s.

Responsibilities


Manage a variety of data sources to identify and analyze trends, variances, and anomalies in performance data to develop spending recommendations for the executive team.
Conduct performance analysis on media buying and conversions
Produce reports and dashboards in a variety of formats to clearly communicate results of analysis.
Collaborate directly with internal stakeholders to identify areas of optimization or improved performance.
Stay up to date with trends and optimization strategies


Preferred Qualifications and Experience


MS in a quantitative discipline (e.g., sciences, mathematics, business intelligence, economics, accounting, operations research, business)
Ability to extract and manipulate data from multiple, complex data sources with a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to tackle complex analysis from multiple data sources and produce actionable business solutions.
Experience with predictive modeling and forecasting
Detailed oriented and motivated to learn and improve business and analytic skills.
Experience with business intelligence tools and web analytics packages, including Tableau
Database experience, preferably:
Hadoop/HDFS/MapReduce environment
Hive query environment
PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle SQL environments
Redis
Data interchange formats, especially JSON and XML
Scripting writing in languages such as Bash, Perl, or Python
Professional Abilities


Ability to work independently with minimal direction
Initiative-taker and finisher
Ability to manage multiple priorities at one time and manage tight deadlines
Ability to proactively follow-up on open and unclear items
Complete work with an important level of accuracy and able to quality check own work
Powerful desire to succeed and be part of a winning team
Ability to communicate effectively across various functions and disciplines, including at the executive level


Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

POLY Consulting Inc. is a market growth consultancy that helps businesses recalibrate their marketplace and workplace strategy. Born out of a business heritage in multicultural communications, POLY was founded on the idea that previously proven, traditional playbooks are waning in efficacy, and out-of-step with today’s market. We understand the complexities of a diverse U.S. consumer base fusing deep knowledge and cultural attunement with pragmatic solutions that impact market growth of new and next generation consumers.

POLY is part of a privately owned holding company with blue chip clients.

Job Description

Based in Huntington Beach, CA, we are looking for anentry-level, full-timeteam member to support our strategists and senior leaders with data-driven insights and presentations. This is a full-time in-office position. Compensation is $65,000 to $75,000 annually.

In this role, you’ll learn how to use marketplace research tools and develop the analytical foundation needed for a career in strategy, consulting, or marketing. You will work closely with senior team members and be a key contributor in developing insights that shape client growth strategies.

Qualifications

These skills will be needed to do the job:


A degree in Statistics, Computer Science or similar fields
Strong analytical and research skills
Proficiency in advanced Excel (modeling, analysis, dashboards) Skills & ETL processesto build multi-layered models
Ability to assess and qualify research needs
Clear, concise communication and presentation skills
Ability to translate data into actionable insights and convert them into data-driven decks (PowerPoint/Keynote) to provide a point of view on the results
Familiarity with tools like MRI/Simmons, Nielsen/IRI, Sprout Social, Claritas, Global Web Index, & Helixa
Interest or basic knowledge of AI
Exposure to marketing, consulting, or business strategy environments
Experience in Python, R, SQL


Additional Information

https://www.poly-consulting.com/

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why We Exist and What We Do:

At Dr. Squatch (www.drsquatch.com), we’re raising the bar on men’s personal care with our line of natural, high-performance products. We’re on a high-growth, fast-moving ride, continually introducing new product categories, launching into retailers nationwide, and growing internationally. We have been recognized and certified by Great Place to Work® multiple times, and we achieved status as a certified B Corp in 2023. We are looking for passionate, talented people who want to join us in our mission to inspire and educate men to be happier and healthier!

About the Role:

Dr. Squatch is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Data team. The Data Analyst will be a driving force in creating useful analysis and reporting for teams across Dr. Squatch. By understanding the needs of business leaders and building reporting or creating analyses to meet those needs, the Data Analyst will help teams across the organization spend less time finding data and more time acting on insights gleaned from our data. The Data Analyst will work on a variety of projects and data sources. The analysis and reporting that the Data Analyst creates will inform key decisions across the business.

This role will report to the Associate Director, Data & Analytics.

This is a full-time, hybrid role with company benefits based in Marina del Rey, CA.

The anticipated base compensation range for this role will be $80,000 to $100,000. Compensation will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and local market rates.

What You'll Do:


Build and maintain reporting in our core business intelligence platform (Looker).
Create and maintain data models to filter and transform data to produce clean data sets.
Develop a deep understanding of our business and use that knowledge to identify insights in our data that others have not discovered.
Analyze data based on ad-hoc requests from business leaders, producing complete, accurate analyses that provide actionable insights.
Debug and troubleshoot issues that may arise in various tools used by the Data team (Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Looker).
Be a go-to resource for non-technical users in our business intelligence platform, helping them find and understand data.


About You:


At least 1 year of SQL experience with a focus on querying, transforming, and analyzing data
At least 1 year working with business intelligence tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode, etc.)
Experience working with cloud data warehouses (Redshift, Azure, Snowflake, etc.)
Python/R/other programming skills are a plus
Strong communication skills
Problem solver with a sense of urgency
Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to take ownership
Preferred, but not required: Experience in ecommerce/direct-to-consumer businesses
Strong dbt knowledge is a plus
Familiarity with ETL tools is a plus
You can get things done without perfect resources, are innovative, and work with a sense of urgency
You have high standards, take ownership of your work, and are invested in the outcome
You proactively help others, stay positive, and have a good sense of humor
You enjoy working with data and applying the insights you find in it
You work independently, ensuring work is completed on time regardless of the challenges that come up


Who We Are:

Our core values come naturally and make us a better, more whole, and unique team. We are Bold & Innovative - we are creative, rethink how things are done, and find a way. We Play to Win - we have high standards, we encourage ownership of work, we are scrappy, we act with urgency, and we invest in the outcome of our work. We are Team Squatch - we are humble, help others outside our own wheelhouse, stay positive, have fun, and have approachable and transparent leadership.

We offer a competitive salary in a growth-focused & collaborative team environment. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401k with Squatch match, and PTO. We also have great perks like healthy snacks, frequent company events, and of course, free products!

For Applicants with Disabilities. Reasonable accommodation will be made so that qualified applicants with disabilities may participate in the application process. If you need any accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know when you submit your application and we'll do our very best to adjust as needed.

For Information regarding Data Privacy, please review https://privacy.drsquatch.com/.

Unsolicited Resume Policy. Dr. Squatch (“DRSQ”) employs an internal Talent Acquisition department. Exceptionally, DRSQ may choose to supplement that internal team with support from temporary staffing agencies, placement services, and/or recruiting agencies ("Agency"). Agencies are hereby specifically directed NOT to contact DRSQ employees directly in an attempt to present candidates. DRSQ’s Talent Acquisition team is responsible for all candidate presentations to our hiring managers.

To protect the interests of all parties, Dr. Squatch will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to DRSQ, including unsolicited resumes sent to a DRSQ email address or mailing address, directly to DRSQ employees, or to DRSQ’s resume database will be considered property of Dr. Squatch.

DRSQ will not pay a placement, service or other fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. This also includes partial resumes, LinkedIn profiles, general candidate profiles, and/or candidate details or information. DRSQ will consider any candidate for whom an Agency has submitted an unsolicited resume to have been referred by the Agency free of any charges or fees.

DRSQ’s Talent Acquisition team must provide advance written approval to an Agency to submit resumes and/or profiles for a specific job-opening, and the approval must be in conjunction with a valid fully executed staffing, placement or other service agreement. DRSQ will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have a fully executed agreement in place prior to submission, receipt and placement of candidates.


Show more
HTML:
Why We Exist and What We Do:

At Dr. Squatch (www.drsquatch.com), we’re raising the bar on men’s personal care with our line of natural, high-performance products. We’re on a high-growth, fast-moving ride, continually introducing new product categories, launching into retailers nationwide, and growing internationally. We have been recognized and certified by Great Place to Work® multiple times, and we achieved status as a certified B Corp in 2023. We are looking for passionate, talented people who want to join us in our mission to inspire and educate men to be happier and healthier!

About the Role:

Dr. Squatch is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our Data team. The Data Analyst will be a driving force in creating useful analysis and reporting for teams across Dr. Squatch. By understanding the needs of business leaders and building reporting or creating analyses to meet those needs, the Data Analyst will help teams across the organization spend less time finding data and more time acting on insights gleaned from our data. The Data Analyst will work on a variety of projects and data sources. The analysis and reporting that the Data Analyst creates will inform key decisions across the business.

This role will report to the Associate Director, Data & Analytics.

This is a full-time, hybrid role with company benefits based in Marina del Rey, CA.

The anticipated base compensation range for this role will be $80,000 to $100,000. Compensation will be commensurate with the candidate's experience and local market rates.

What You'll Do:

  • Build and maintain reporting in our core business intelligence platform (Looker).
  • Create and maintain data models to filter and transform data to produce clean data sets.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our business and use that knowledge to identify insights in our data that others have not discovered.
  • Analyze data based on ad-hoc requests from business leaders, producing complete, accurate analyses that provide actionable insights.
  • Debug and troubleshoot issues that may arise in various tools used by the Data team (Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Looker).
  • Be a go-to resource for non-technical users in our business intelligence platform, helping them find and understand data.

About You:

  • At least 1 year of SQL experience with a focus on querying, transforming, and analyzing data
  • At least 1 year working with business intelligence tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode, etc.)
  • Experience working with cloud data warehouses (Redshift, Azure, Snowflake, etc.)
  • Python/R/other programming skills are a plus
  • Strong communication skills
  • Problem solver with a sense of urgency
  • Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to take ownership
  • Preferred, but not required: Experience in ecommerce/direct-to-consumer businesses
  • Strong dbt knowledge is a plus
  • Familiarity with ETL tools is a plus
  • You can get things done without perfect resources, are innovative, and work with a sense of urgency
  • You have high standards, take ownership of your work, and are invested in the outcome
  • You proactively help others, stay positive, and have a good sense of humor
  • You enjoy working with data and applying the insights you find in it
  • You work independently, ensuring work is completed on time regardless of the challenges that come up

Who We Are:

Our core values come naturally and make us a better, more whole, and unique team. We are Bold & Innovative - we are creative, rethink how things are done, and find a way. We Play to Win - we have high standards, we encourage ownership of work, we are scrappy, we act with urgency, and we invest in the outcome of our work. We are Team Squatch - we are humble, help others outside our own wheelhouse, stay positive, have fun, and have approachable and transparent leadership.

We offer a competitive salary in a growth-focused & collaborative team environment. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, 401k with Squatch match, and PTO. We also have great perks like healthy snacks, frequent company events, and of course, free products!

For Applicants with Disabilities. Reasonable accommodation will be made so that qualified applicants with disabilities may participate in the application process. If you need any accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know when you submit your application and we'll do our very best to adjust as needed.

For Information regarding Data Privacy, please review https://privacy.drsquatch.com/.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description


GREAT WORK FROM HOME OPPORTUNITY!
Candidate must be within Eastern Timezone!
Candidate must have experience in using Excel, Power BI and SQL!
This position falls under the purview of Finance Operations!


The role of a Data Analyst is to closely work with Business Stakeholders and Program Operations to successfully complete various projects as assigned. The role will be responsible for developing ad hoc reports and suggesting to perform in-depth data analysis to meet the business need. The Data Analyst is also responsible for troubleshooting and resolving data issues, conducting data research, partnering with the lines of businesses and Data Stewards to deploy and support the data quality cleanup efforts. The Data Analyst focuses on retrieving complex data from disparate sources and condensing it into one simple format where it can be utilized by team members. The candidate in this role must have a basic understanding of project management concepts and techniques and should have the skills to execute the activities necessary to reach the project objectives.

Responsibilities


Collects, evaluates and prepares research and/or other complex statistical data and maintains computerized collection and tracking of relevant data.
Shares responsibility and collaborates with line of business SMEs for performing data analysis (deep diving) for businesses requests and to design/develop ad hoc reports. Aggregates and performs analysis on data based on requests from project teams or senior leadership.
Compiles/prepares manual reports of findings, observations and recommendations into statistical and narrative reports. Integrates data from multiple data sources and ensures data accuracy and integrity. Makes updates as necessary.
Utilize specialized software to analyze and interpret research data (via Excel). Interprets data to identify business trends, conducts root cause analysis of business problems, or suggests areas for process improvement.
Work directly with program operations to identify, investigate, and resolve technical issues. Writes queries or reports to provide data for various analytical projects.
Maintain appropriate records of research methods and results.
Design and/or develop and ensure the quality of specific databases for collection, tracking, and reporting of research data (via Microsoft Sharepoint).
Effectively communicate project status to management and business stakeholders.
Upholds the Crawford Code of Conduct.


Qualifications


Computer/technical skill training.
Working knowledge of Insurance and Management concepts and techniques.
Advance knowledge of business support applications such as MS Office (Word, Power Point, Excel, Project) required.
Strong exposure to SQL and accessing database structures for database systems such as Oracle or Microsoft SQL Server or Microsoft Access.
Extensive experience in using PowerBI to create story telling visualizations.
Knowledge and/or experience with business or data modeling is preferred.
Ability to facilitate effective and efficient meetings to gather information and outline processes.
Work successfully in a fast-paced and constantly changing environment in which meticulous attention to detail is expected.
Exhibit exceptional organizational, time management, multi-tasking, and analytical/problem solving skills.
Takes initiative to accomplish business objectives, seek new assignments, and request to learn more about the business.


Physical Requirements


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Ability to talk and hear.
Ability to see and read.
Reaching and manual dexterity for operating computer keyboard.
The employee is required to extend hands and arms in various directions in order to handle files and associated paperwork; use hands/fingers in repetitive motion in keyboard usage; use hands/fingers to efficiently utilize a writing instrument.
Stooping kneeling, crouching, crawling, standing, sitting, walking, pushing, pulling, is relative to office files, etc..
Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word is required, as well as the ability to convey detailed/important instructions in an accurate manner.
Ability to frequently talk or hear on a telephone and receive detailed information through oral communication is required.
Exertion up to 20 pounds of force is occasionally required and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects.
Visual activity requirements are those of Clerical Administrative. This is a minimum standard for use with those whose work deals largely with preparing and analyzing data and figures, accounting, computer terminal, extensive reading, operation of machines, and using measurement devices.




About Us

Why Crawford?

Because a claim is more than a number — it’s a person, a child, a friend. It’s anyone who looks to Crawford on their worst days. And by helping to restore their lives, we are helping to restore our community – one claim at a time.

At Crawford, employees are empowered to grow, emboldened to act and inspired to innovate. Our industry-leading team pioneers new solutions for the industries and customers we serve. We’re looking for the next generation of leaders to take this journey with us.

We hail from more than 70 countries and speak dozens of languages, reflecting the global fabric of the audience we serve. Though our reach is vast, we proudly operate as One Crawford: united in purpose, vision and values. Learn more at www.crawco.com .

When you accept a job with Crawford, you become a part of the One Crawford family.

Our total compensation plans provide each of our employees with far more than just a great salary


Pay and incentive plans that recognize performance excellence
Benefit programs that empower financial, physical, and mental wellness
Training programs that promote continuous learning and career progression while enhancing job performance
Sustainability programs that give back to the communities in which we live and work
A culture of respect, collaboration, entrepreneurial spirit and inclusion


Crawford & Company participates in E-Verify and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/D/V Crawford & Company is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Crawford via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written Statement of Work in place for this position from Crawford HR/Recruitment will be deemed the sole property of Crawford. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Crawford as a result of the referral or through other means.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Fanduel

FanDuel Group is the premier mobile gaming company in the United States and Canada. FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across mobile wagering including: America’s #1 Sportsbook, FanDuel Sportsbook; its leading iGaming platform, FanDuel Casino; the industry’s unquestioned leader in horse racing and advance-deposit wagering, FanDuel Racing; and its daily fantasy sports product.

In addition, FanDuel Group operates FanDuel TV, its broadly distributed linear cable television network and FanDuel TV+, its leading direct-to-consumer OTT platform. FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states, Canada, and Puerto Rico.

The company is based in New York with US offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta, and Jersey City, as well as global offices in Canada and Scotland. The company’s affiliates have offices worldwide, including in Ireland, Portugal, Romania, and Australia.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

FanDuel is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a pivotal role in growing the experimentation function within the Sportsbook Commercial team. You will help to accelerate the scalability and sophistication of best-in-class experimentation practice while maintaining standardization of processes across teams. The Senior Analyst will partner with several commercial stakeholders and will be responsible for designing and analyzing experiments that help to answer key business questions. This person will have the opportunity to be a part of designing technical solutions that support FanDuel’s ability to test and learn at scale, driving a strong culture of data informed decision making.

In addition to the specific responsibilities outlined above, employees may be required to perform other such duties as assigned by the Company. This ensures operational flexibility and allows the Company to meet evolving business needs.

THE GAME PLAN

Everyone on our team has a part to play


Own end-to-end delivery of experiments (e.g., A/B/n, multivariate, multi-armed bandit), including design, execution and analysis, ensuring best practices and statistical rigor are met across all stages.
Be a key partner to Sportsbook Commercial teams in advancing our understanding generosity and customer value proposition. Work closely with analytical teams to gather insights and develop testable hypotheses driven by these insights.
Provide thought leadership in experimentation capabilities development. Partner with teams across the organization (Product, Data Science, MLE, etc.) to implement scalable, modular solutions.
Mentor junior analysts to help build their technical skills, such as statistical analysis, coding best practices.
Drive FanDuel’s test-and-learn mindset across teams by promoting the value of experimentation, sharing results transparently, and encouraging iterative improvement.



THE STATS

What we're looking for in our next teammate


3+ years of experience in data focused role such as data science, analytics or research.
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Economics, Computer Science or similar domain.
Experience designing and running A/B/n experiments in a fast-paced environment. Familiarity with advanced testing techniques (multi-armed bandit, synthetic controls) a plus.
Advanced experience with SQL, Python and/or object-oriented programming. Experience with Databricks, including packaging code and app deployment a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills, with ability to work through ambiguity and deliver solutions to business problems.
Commercial acumen: understanding of P&L, business principles and commercial levers
A “can-do” attitude and the type of person who constantly looks for solutions and better ways of operating
Knowledge of sports and/or experience working within a heavily regulated industry is a plus
Don’t check all the boxes? That’s okay! We encourage you to still apply if you feel like you possess an adjacent skill set and are interested in learning more about this position.



Player Benefits

We treat our team right

We offer amazing benefits above and beyond the basics. We have an array of health plans to choose from (some as low as $0 per paycheck) that include programs for fertility and family planning, mental health support, and fitness benefits. We offer generous paid time off (PTO & sick leave), annual bonus and long-term incentive opportunities (based on performance), 401k with up to a 5% match, commuter benefits, pet insurance, and more - check out all our benefits here: FanDuel Total Rewards. *Benefits differ across location, role, and level.

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principles states, “We are One Team!”. As such, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.

The applicable salary range for this position is $94,000 - $117,500 USD, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Functional Analyst

Duration: 6 Month(s), Contract to Hire

Location: Cincinnati, OH

Information

Top 3 Skills:

R (data cleaning, performing calculations on large datasets, performing exploratory data analysis). You will also use Python on occasion.

PowerBI (especially with DAX). Almost all of the data reporting is done in Power BI. Working with Power Query, Dataflows, Row Level Security (RLS) and writing measures with DAX will be a big part of your job.

A great eye for visualization and a focus on the user experience. Our team attaches a lot of importance to making our reports nice looking and user friendly.

Remote candidates will be considered.

Job Description

- Assist with the maintenance of daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly business reporting functions.

- Gather Retail Operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors to complete analyze.

- Transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling.

- Leverage Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to build and maintain custom reports and dashboards to reveal trends and correlations in large data sets.

- Implement row level security in the Power BI (and other data visualization tools) to enable secured viewing of the reports for designated job levels and locations.

- Identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities and improve processes.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the data needs to execute department and enterprise-wide strategic objectives and initiatives.

- Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, manager, and the team.

- Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

• Standardize and solidify data processes and quality

• Assist in developing business reporting

• Increase data availability, standardization and automation processes

• Problem solve and investigate issues

• Participate in all phases of system testing Work successfully in an Agile Project across multiple feature and component teams

• Complete estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) Meetings as appropriate for design, development, implementation and rollout tasks

- Provide data insights and solutions to leaders to drive decision-making.

Key Responsibilities

• Standardize and solidify data processes and quality

• Assist in developing business reporting

• Increase data availability, standardization and automation processes

• Problem solve and investigate issues

• Participate in all phases of system testing Work successfully in an Agile Project across multiple feature and component teams

• Complete estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) Meetings as appropriate for design, development, implementation and rollout tasks

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Internship Details


Duration: 6 months + 6 months
Location: Madrid, attendance to the office required 3 days a week
Schedule: Monday to Friday, from 10am to 19pm
Start date 7th July


The Studio Operations team is a global team across 30+ locations and includes Quality Verification and Standards, Central Development Operations, Localization, Animation, Audio, Capture, Rigging and Blendshapes. As a central team, we bring together the best development solutions to further support game teams in achieving their vision and EA's ambition to be the best place to make games.

Within Studio Operations, we are members of the Player & Quality Insights team that focuses on understanding player behavior and designing player feedback events which help game teams develop high-quality games to meet our player's expectations. We are a data-driven team where every major decision starts with data analysis to find opportunity areas and to measure our efforts.

Working alongside our Data Analysts team, you will oversee and conduct the conversion of data into insights to lead to informed decisions. You will help with the development, implementation, testing and maintenance of our data systems infrastructure, including semantic models, dashboards and reports to help teams analyse and investigate their results.

Key Duties And Responsibilities


Conduct data analyses using statistical software, databases and BI tools
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate and clean data from different sources
Create, operate and maintain script-driven methodologies for the generation of analysis and reports.
Perform quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
Interacting with internal clients
Dealing with data providers in client organizations, specifically in the development of data requests, checking of data received, and follow up with data providers on data issues.
Dealing directly with clients on projects involving technical methodologies
Presenting results to clients in a clear and respectful manner, and maintaining professionalism in collecting feedback
Project management and quality assurance of active projects
Dashboard and Visualization Development
Develop visually appealing and intuitive dashboards
Leverage advanced visualization techniques to effectively communicate insights
Ensure adherence to best practices in data visualization, story building and user experience design

Required


Student of Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Economics or similar studies.
Advanced level of English, both written and verbal, strong communication skills
Strong analytical skills
Knowledge of SQL, R Statistical software and/or Python
Knowledge of Business Intelligence principles and concepts
Interest in gaming is a big plus.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst (F/H)
HTML:
Lindt & Sprüngli, entreprise internationale du secteur agro-alimentaire est reconnue comme l'un des principaux leaders sur le marché du chocolat au travers de marques emblématiques telles que Lindor, Excellence, Champs-Elysées et Pyrénéens.


Venez enchanter le monde en rejoignant notre équipe commerciale à Paris Trocadéro.


Le/la Data Analyst participe à la transformation data-driven de la DNV (Direction Nationale des Ventes) en assurant la disponibilité, la qualité et la pertinence des données GMS (Grandes & Moyennes Surfaces). Il/elle structure les données, délivre les tableaux de bord sous les formats les plus pertinents et recommande les meilleures solutions data au service de la performance de la Direction Commerciale.


Missions :

Analyse et exploitation des données GMS :

  • Collecter les besoins métiers, croiser les sources, produire des analyses claires et activables pour les équipes de la DNV (siège et terrain) ;
  • Fournir des analyses ponctuelles ou récurrentes à la DNV et à la Direction Commerciale ;
  • Garantir la fiabilité et la qualité des données (algorithmes de scoring, suivi des anomalies…) avec le support des chargés d’animation des ventes.


Production et amélioration continue des outils d’analyse de données GMS :

  • Identifier et mettre à disposition des produits data à forte valeur ajoutée : dashboards, reportings, jeux de données, outils d’aide à la décision… ;
  • Créer, maintenir et déployer des dashboards de suivi de performance GMS (KPIs Force de Vente) avec le support de la DSI (Direction des Systèmes d’Information) ;
  • Être force de proposition sur l’évolution des outils de suivi de la performance GMS et sur les meilleures solutions d’analyse de données.


Communication et acculturation « Data » :

  • Être lead sur des sujets transverses avec la DCN/DCM pour moderniser les outils internes et les projets d’interface avec le CRM ;
  • Favoriser l’appropriation des outils analytiques au sein des équipes, former à leur utilisation et impulser une dynamique globale autour des usages des données ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes data, IT et métiers pour délivrer les projets ;
  • Être en veille sur nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse de données.


Parcours :

  • Formation bac+4/5 (école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou équivalent) avec une spécialisation en analyse de données ;
  • Expérience de 3 à 4 ans sur des missions similaires ;
  • Solide compréhension des indicateurs de performance commerciale ; une bonne connaissance des enjeux GMS sera fortement appréciée (ou, à défaut, une ouverture d’esprit sur l’univers Sales).


Compétences techniques :

  • Expertise en visualisation et interprétation de données ;
  • Capacité à modéliser des données complexes dans un environnement multi-sources ;
  • Maîtrise des concepts de qualité et de fiabilité des données ;
  • Maîtrise des outils BI (notamment Power BI), manipulation de bases de données ;
  • Aisance avec les outils d’IA générative (ex. : Copilot, ChatGPT) et de productivité moderne.


Savoir-être et relationnel :

  • Excellentes capacités de communication, vulgarisation et pédagogie ;
  • Leadership transversal, capacité à embarquer des profils techniques et métiers ;
  • Rigueur, sens de l’analyse et goût pour la donnée ;
  • Esprit d’équipe, écoute active et orientation utilisateur ;
  • Adaptabilité, autonomie, curiosité, sens de l’initiative.

Title: Data Analytics and Insights Analyst
Description:
DATA INSIGHTS and ANALYTICS ANALYST




PURPOSE OF THE JOB:




• Support with data and insights, align inputs to the Segmented Execution use case (products OOS, overstock, key challenges/opportunities)

• Support Data Analytics & AI Manager and colleagues on delivering updates and organizing communications to end users with involved stakeholders (mainly sales & TM)

• Reporting and Data Visualization & Dashboarding for cases (PowerBI based reports)

• Support data inventory and data managements processes (coordinating and archiving data mapping activities)

• Get knowledge about and act as SME of data sources towards the organization (both corporate and local)




SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:




• Management of data sources

• Strong analytical skills which will allow the generation of strong recommendations based on insights

• Customer centric approach and knowledge of Company priorities.

• Ability to use and communicate data

• Relationship building - Strong ability to form effective working partnerships with all functions

• IT and Advanced analytics literacy (PowerBI or equivalent)

• Analytical mindset

• Experience in analytics related departments

• Excel power functions: Map/View/Pivot/Query

• MS Office – deep knowledge and experience




EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:




1) University degree, ideally business/economics related

2) Strong business acumen backed by a comfort in dealing with analysis and numbers.

3) Previous 2/3 years' experience in advanced analytics, business insights and project management considered as a plus




WHERE WILL YOU WORK




Sesto San Giovanni (MI)




DISCOVER WHO WE ARE




Coca-Cola HBC Italia, part of the Coca-Cola HBC Group, is the leading bottler and distributor of The Coca-Cola Company's branded products in Italy.




We employ around 2,000 people and operate through 6 facilities: 3 dedicated to the production of soft drinks located in Nogara, Oricola, and Marcianise, 2 mineral water bottling sites, Fonti del Vulture in Rionero in Vulture and Lurisia in Roccaforte Mondovì, and an innovative hub in Gaglianico dedicated to the production of recycled plastic (rPET) bottles for the bottling of the company's products.




Coca-Cola HBC Italia is on the market as a 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, this means that with our products we can cover all consumption occasions, from breakfast, to after dinner.




Customer first, We over I, Deliver Sustainable, Make It Simple: these are the values that define Coca-Cola HBC.




AT COCA-COLA HBC WE FOSTER DIVERSITY




At Coca-Cola HBC, we are an inclusive employer that thrives on diversity. This means our environment provides equal opportunities for all, regardless of race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. Join us in nurturing a culture where everyone belongs and contributes to our collective success.




Searches are open to male and female candidates (Law 903/77 and Law 125/91). Candidates are invited to read our privacy notice on our website: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/ in compliance with D. Lgs. 196/2003.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Company: Financiera El Corte Inglés E.F.C, S.A.
Description:
📊 Convierte los datos en decisiones estratégicas en Financiera El Corte Inglés




En Financiera El Corte Inglés, potenciamos la innovación y la eficiencia en cada área de negocio. Si te apasiona traducir datos en insights que impulsen resultados, queremos contar contigo. Buscamos un perfil analítico para apoyar la estrategia comercial a través del análisis de datos, campañas e incentivos.




🎯 Tu misión




Serás el nexo entre los datos y las decisiones. Diseñarás herramientas visuales, analizarás el rendimiento comercial e impulsarás mejoras estratégicas alineadas con los objetivos del negocio.




🛠️ Funciones principales




Diseñar, implementar y mantener cuadros de mando comerciales.
Analizar el comportamiento y resultados de la fuerza de ventas.
Optimizar sistemas de incentivos alineados con la estrategia.
Evaluar campañas comerciales y proponer mejoras.
Coordinarte con equipos multifuncionales para garantizar calidad y disponibilidad de los datos.
Elaborar informes de seguimiento con KPIs.
Organizar y explotar bases de datos comerciales.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?

-Grado/Licenciatura en ADE, Económicas, Ingeniería, Estadística o similar.

-2-3 años de experiencia en análisis comercial, idealmente en financiero o retail.

-Conocimiento en productos financieros, procesos comerciales y herramientas como Power BI, Excel avanzado, VBA y bases de datos.

-Inglés nivel medio.




🎁 ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

-Proyectos retadores e impacto directo en la estrategia.

-Retribución flexible: tarjeta restaurante, transporte y guardería.

-Flexibilidad horaria y 30% de teletrabajo.

-Formación continua y clases de inglés.

-Descuentos exclusivos para empleados.




📈 Si buscas llevar el análisis comercial al siguiente nivel, este es tu momento.

Únete a nuestro equipo y transforma datos en decisiones con Financiera El Corte Inglés.




#Empleo #AnálisisComercial #DataDriven #PowerBI #RetailFinance #OportunidadProfesional

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
🚀 Are you the NEX T Data Analyst? 🚀


O que valorizamos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Estatística, Matemática ou áreas afins;
  • Domínio de SQL e Python;
  • Experiência com ferramentas de ETL como SSIS;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em Power BI e SSRS para criação de dashboards, relatórios e visualizações impactantes;
  • Pensamento crítico e raciocínio analítico para tomada de decisões baseadas em dados;
  • Capacidade de inovação e pensamento criativo para resolução de problemas fora do padrão;
  • Excelentes habilidades de apresentação e comunicação visual e verbal;


O que podes esperar desta função:

📍 Lisboa

💻 Híbrido

  • Extração, transformação e análise de dados para suportar decisões estratégicas;
  • Criação de relatórios e dashboards que comuniquem insights de forma clara e acionável;
  • Colaboração com stakeholders para entender necessidades de negócio e traduzir em soluções de dados;
  • Aplicação de boas práticas estatísticas para validar hipóteses e análises;
  • Participação em iniciativas de melhoria contínua e transformação digital.


O que te proporcionamos:

  • Equipa dinâmica e profissional;
  • Possibilidade de participação em projetos locais ou internacionais;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação adequado às tuas necessidades;
  • Orientação para a progressão e desenvolvimento de carreira;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.

Se os dados são o teu idioma e gostas de os transformar em impacto real, esta vaga é para ti! 💡

Junta-te à NEX T e faz a diferença com análise, visão e propósito.


Partilha o teu CV para your@nextengineering.pt com a REFª AOL.

Title: Data Insights and Analytics Internship
Description:
UNISCITI AL TEAM

Se ti interessa l’ambito Data Insights & Analytics e vuoi lavorare in un ambiente dinamico, questa è l’opportunità per te!




COSA FAREMO INSIEME

Supportare con dati e insights, allineare gli input al progetto Segmented Execution (mantenimento assortimento, opportunità di sviluppo, principali gap da colmare)
Supportare il Data Analytics & AI Manager e i colleghi nel fornire aggiornamenti all'organizzazione attraverso comunicazioni sia agli utenti finali che agli altri stakeholder coinvolti (principalmente Sales e Trade Marketing)
Creare report, visualizzare i dati e creare dashboard (report basati su PowerBI)
Supportare i processi di data inventory e gestione dei dati (coordinare e archiviare le attività di mappatura dei dati)
Acquisire conoscenze e agire come esperto delle fonti di dati e dei risultati dei modelli verso l'organizzazione







COSA TI OFFRIAMO

Prevediamo un inserimento in stage dalla durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga, oltre a:

Work-life balance: possibilità di lavoro da remoto e orari flessibili
Opportunità di crescita: investiamo nel tuo sviluppo professionale
Ambiente inclusivo: accogliamo la diversità e valorizziamo l’inclusione




SEI LA PERSONA GIUSTA SE…

Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacità analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
Hai la capacità di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacità relazionali
Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sarà considerato un vantaggio




DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilità di svolgere attività in smartworking 12 giorni al mese




SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, è il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‑Cola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondovì, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all’imbottigliamento dei prodotti dell’azienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, più forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.




LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversità delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunità a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo




Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l’informativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).




Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Note dalla tua recruiter Elisa: “Se pensi che questa opportunità sia per te, anche se non soddisfi tutti i requisiti, candidati comunque..potresti essere la persona di cui abbiamo bisogno. Cosa aspetti? Corri a candidarti e..let’s open up a moment that refresh us all!”

  • Hai una laurea triennale o magistrale, idealmente in ambito economico/aziendale
  • Hai un’ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese
  • Hai una propensione verso i dettagli e possiedi forti capacità analitiche che ti permetteranno di generare raccomandazioni solide basate sugli insights ottenuti
  • Hai la capacità di utilizzare e comunicare i dati e forti capacità relazionali
  • Hai una conoscenza avanzata di MS Office (Map/View/Pivot/Query)
  • Se hai precedenti esperienze accademiche o lavorative nel campo dell'analisi dei dati, sarà considerato un vantaggio


DOVE LAVORERAI

Sesto San Giovanni (MI), con possibilità di svolgere attività in smartworking 12 giorni al mese


SCOPRI CHI SIAMO

Coca-Cola HBC Italia, parte del Gruppo Coca-Cola HBC, è il principale imbottigliatore e distributore di prodotti a marchio The Coca‑Cola Company sul territorio nazionale.

Impieghiamo circa 2.000 dipendenti e operiamo attraverso 6 stabilimenti: 3 dedicati alla produzione di bibite situati a Nogara, Oricola, Marcianise, 2 siti di imbottigliamento di acque minerali, Fonti del Vulture a Rionero in Vulture e Lurisia a Roccaforte Mondovì, e un innovativo polo situato a Gaglianico dedicato alla produzione di bottiglie in plastica riciclata (rPET) destinate all’imbottigliamento dei prodotti dell’azienda.

Ci presentiamo sul mercato come un 24/7 Total Beverage Partner, con un portafoglio prodotti in grado di coprire tutte le occasioni di consumo, dalla colazione fino al dopocena.

Il cliente al centro, più forti insieme, agiamo sostenibilmente, favoriamo la semplificazione: questi sono i valori che caratterizzano Coca-Cola HBC.


LA NOSTRA PROMESSA DI INCLUSIONE

Gli ingredienti segreti di Coca-Cola HBC sono una cultura inclusiva e la valorizzazione della diversità delle nostre persone. Offriamo pari opportunità a tutti, costruendo un ambiente sostenibile in cui ogni individuo contribuisce in modo equo al successo collettivo


Le ricerche sono rivolte ai candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso (L. 903/77 e L. 125/91). I candidati sono invitati a leggere sul nostro sito: www.cocacolahellenic.it/Privacystatement/

l’informativa sulla privacy (D. Lgs. 196/2003).


Non ti abbiamo ancora convinto?

Note dalla tua recruiter Elisa: “Se pensi che questa opportunità sia per te, anche se non soddisfi tutti i requisiti, candidati comunque..potresti essere la persona di cui abbiamo bisogno. Cosa aspetti? Corri a candidarti e..let’s open up a moment that refresh us all!”

Title: E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: E-commerce & Omnichannel

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.

This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.




Your Contribution:

Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.




Your Skills:

2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Experience with SQL.
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Quienes somos: Randstad Digital somos la empresa de consultoría tecnológica del grupo Randstad especializada en servicios tecnológicos estables. A nivel global estamos presente en más de 20 paises y contamos con más de 25.000 especialistas IT y a nivel nacional con más de 400 y tenemos oficinas en Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Sevilla, Zaragoza, Bilbao y Valladolid.

Llevamos a cabo servicios de IT e ingeniería apasionantes y con las últimas tecnologías. Cuidamos de nuestr@s trabajadores mediante el trato humano que nos caracteriza y por ello te impulsamos para seguir creciendo sin límites!




Nuestro objetivo: Crecer e impulsar junt@s en equipo el liderazgo digital para innovar y marcar la diferencia basándonos en la responsabilidad social tecnológica, conectando personas y tecnología.

Tus funciones: Si tu trayectoria profesional está orientada al desarrollo de aplicaciones java y cuentas con una sólida experiencia profesional ¡Queremos conocerte!




¿Cómo será tu día a día?




Diseñar y desarrollar paneles en Power BI basados en los requisitos de los usuarios, asegurando precisión, relevancia y claridad visual.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas de UX/UI para garantizar un diseño intuitivo y fácil de usar en todas las visualizaciones.
Coordinar y facilitar la entrega de los objetivos del proyecto, asegurando alineación con los plazos, expectativas de los interesados y metas comerciales.




Requisitos del puesto: Si te ves reflejad@, te animamos a asumir este reto.




3 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI. Experiencia demostrada en la creación de paneles, informes y visualizaciones de datos a nivel empresarial.
Experiencia en diseño UX/UI con enfoque en usabilidad, coherencia y alineación con la marca.
Gran capacidad para trabajar en equipo y comunicarse eficazmente con los interesados del negocio.
Se requiere certificación PL-300




VALORABLE: Conocimiento de Microsoft Fabric (Lakehouse, Direct Lake, Dataflows Gen2) y certificación DP-600.




Tus beneficios: ¿A qué esperas para formar parte de nuestro gran equipo Randstad Digital?, aquí encontrarás motivos para ello:

PLAN DE FORMACIÓN CONTINUA, plan de formación anual, acceso a plataforma elearning de formación técnica, plataforma de formación en habilidades...
ACOMPAÑAMIENTO Y PLAN DE CARRERA, Tendrás un referente de Randstad Digital cerca de ti en todo momento.
CONCILIACIÓN, Sabemos que tu vida personal es tan importante como la profesional por eso podrás disfrutar de 23 días de vacaciones y en la mayoría de nuestros proyectos tendrás un horario flexible.
COMPROMISO y ESTABILIDAD, Incorporación a empresa en continuo crecimiento que apuesta por las nuevas tecnologías.
SALARIO COMPETITIVO acorde a tu experiencia profesional.
CONDICIONES contractuales competitivas, Plan de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante y cheques guardería) y Randstad Care, plataforma de ofertas y descuentos exclusivos.
PLAN TRÁETE UN AMIG@, si nos ayudas a incrementar el equipo, te premiaremos con una compensación económica.

Se garantiza la confidencialidad en el proceso de selección.

¿Tienes ganas y te ves preparado/a para asumir un nuevo reto como el nuestro?

¡Te estamos esperando! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJVLc3JtdsA

#somosRSC Randstad promueve la equidad de oportunidades laborales

a través de equipos diversos e inclusivos. Por ello, en nuestros

procesos, garantizamos la inserción de todas las personas

independientemente de su condición personal, género, orientación

sexual, etnia, cultura, edad, religión o discapacidad.

Title: Data Analyst - Senior Specialist
Description:
Responsabilità della posizione:




All'interno della Direzione Consumer nell'area Customer Base Analytics ricerchiamo una figura di Data Analyst, che si occuperà delle attività di analisi dei comportamenti dei clienti per tipologia di profilo e di utilizzo dei prodotti Sky, al fine di identificare e valutare interventi volti a migliorare il trade-off tra valore ed esperienza del cliente.




Principali attività




In particolare, si occuperà di costruire, analizzare e arricchire costantemente la base dati per:

comprendere i gusti, i bisogni, i percorsi sui differenti touchpoint con Sky e i comportamenti di utilizzo dei prodotti Sky ;
segmentare la customer base al fine di individuare il potenziale di crescita del valore del cliente a seconda delle sue esigenze e del suo profilo,
identificare, attraverso l’analisi quantitativa, eventuali inefficienze, fault di processo o aree di insoddisfazione del cliente
comprendere le reazioni dei clienti a specifici eventi e campagne (ad es. palinsesto, nuovi prodotti e servizi, comunicazioni, interventi tecnologici,…)
quindi, definire, proattivamente o a supporto delle altre strutture interne o esterne alla direzione, le opportune azioni di intervento
consuntivare, i risultati delle azioni messe in campo, sia in fase di test che a regime
infine, interpretare, sintetizzare ed esporre nel modo più appropriato i risultati analitici




Requisiti




Eccellenti capacità di data analysis, processing e mining
buona conoscenza dei software R e/o Python
conoscenza di Tableau
ottime capacità di rappresentazione dei dati analizzati e di esposizione
ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
appassionato di dati, ma con forte business acumen
orientato a prendere decisioni basate sui dati
capacità di comunicazione dei risultati analitici per finalità di business
capacità relazionali e di team building
energia e pro-attività

Show more
