Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

We are looking for an Associate Data Analyst, who will report to Head of Analytics - Identity and Fraud.

What You Will Do


Extract, formulate and manipulate data to create the structured samples necessary to address requirements
Interpret analysis results
Identify and contribute to the resolution of data or analytical problems which may affect on results, looking for advice
Provide status reports to project lead/consultant
Communicate with clients and other departments/divisions within Experian to help ensure accurate implementation of project work
Attend and contribute to client/customer meetings, including presenting own results, conclusions and recommendations in both written and verbal form.


Qualifications

What you will bring:


Degree or equivalent standard, with a high numeric content e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Operational Research, Economics, Physical Sciences.
Experience of statistical / analytical project work.
Understanding of how scoring models are used within implemented solutions.
PC literate with experience in the use of coding languages (namely Python, SAS), statistical packages and Office tools.
Knowledge of Experian ID&F products and scores. Understanding of how these are used within a client environment.
Basic knowledge of ID&F data and value added products and how these are used within a client environment.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst (Flip Team)
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!

Data Analyst (Flip Team)

What you’ll have to do:

  • Analyse data, flows, and operational scenarios to propose projects enhancements or spearhead new initiatives;
  • Creates actionable reports and analysis to answer questions related to product performance and processes efficiency;
  • Creates advanced visualizations starting from the analysed data sets;
  • Ensure accurate data tracking, collection and centralization from diverse sources across the organisation;
  • Proactively identify and implement improvement opportunities, suggesting viable solutions;
  • Collaborate with project team members on design and implementation, ensuring quick resolution of issues to maintain project continuity;
  • Collaborate with project or operational teams and business stakeholders to gather business requirements, supporting the design of new or improved processes;
  • Communicate project status, process standards and changes, and issues and workarounds, clearly and succinctly to the business and operations support team.
  • Create BI functional & technical documentation;
  • Become a "feature promoter" and provide support for business users. Answer the question "how can I do this".

What makes you a good fit:

  • Have around 3 years experience in data analysis, with a proven track record in data visualisation, reporting, and dashboard creation;
  • Proficient in data modelling and forecasting and conducting data integrity checks to uphold the highest standards of quality and consistency;
  • Have a demonstrable passion for refining existing processes and systems, with the creativity to develop innovative new ones as needed;
  • Proficiency in Excel;
  • Good SQL Knowledge;
  • Experience in working with data systems like Power BI, Looker etc.
  • Experience in working with quantitative analysis;
  • Experience in working with large sets of data;
  • Familiar with statistics and the methodology of AB testing;
  • Project management skills;
  • Experience in working with both technical teams and business teams.

What makes you stand out:

  • Hands-on experience with JIRA for project tracking and reporting;
  • A good understanding of network structures, database management, and general technological frameworks;
  • Reporting design techniques.

What we’ve prepared for you:

  • The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
  • An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
  • You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
  • Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
  • If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
  • We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria.

Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡Hola! 🙋




¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.




Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.

Somos más de 3.500 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌

Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻




Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!!




🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Analyst con experiencia avanzada en SQL y Python en Barcelona con 4 años de experiencia. Buscamos una persona que nos ayude a seguir creciendo, con ganas de aportar y seguir evolucionando de la mano de los mejores profesionales, pero sobre todo... ¡en Hiberus buscamos buena gente! 😉




📋🖋️Habilidades y requisitos

Experiencia con SQL nivel avanzado
Experiencia con Python
Experiencia en cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)




🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.




En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.







Hablamos?




www.hiberus.com




#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Title: Data Analyst (Ads Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.

More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams . We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst (Ads Team)

As an Ads Data Analyst, you’ll play a critical role in analyzing considerable amounts of structured and unstructured data generated by both sides of our advertising platform (advertisers and users) and delivering insights that drive product development, customer success, user experience, and business objectives.

eMAG Ads is a distinct business vertical spanning both sides of the Marketplace, advertisers and customers. It consists of a demand-side suite of campaign, budget, targeting management and reporting tools, and a supply-side array of applications responsible for the real-time bidding, delivery and data collection functions of a cohesive PPC advertising Platform.




What you’ll have to do:

Extract, transform and load raw data from access logs, change data capture systems, databases, datalakes and other sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis on structured and unstructured data.
Derive insights and produce monitoring dashboards, reports, funnels and visualisations.
Produce insights from data related to operational, exploratory, hypothesis driven and experimental objectives.
Work closely with product, development, data platform and data science teams in problem and solution discovery, experiment design and decision making processes.
Understand existing datasets and available data; help design and shape new data collection and processing pipelines for new and existing features.
Monitor data quality, operational and experimental metrics and KPIs.




What makes you a good fit:

Proficient in SQL (capable of executing complex SQL queries); proficient in spreadsheet software such as Excel or Google Spreadsheets.
Experienced in deriving and communicating insights from data (abstract), via reports, visualizations or other modes of presentation (concrete), for a diverse stakeholder audience.
Resourceful, problem-solver.
Having a continuous improvement mindset, in love with the problem, not the solution.
Good communication skills, both written and oral (Romanian, English).
2-3 years of proven experience in a Data Analyst or similar role.




What makes you stand out:

Good command of Python/Jupyter Notebook.
Familiarity with Python libraries for more advanced data analysis and visualizations.
Working statistical knowledge.
Experience with query engines (AWS Athena, GCP Big Query, Impala).
Experience with cloud-based data solutions (AWS, GCP).




What we’ve prepared for you:

Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Therme and Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Hilio psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CHI SIAMO

Edenred è leader nel settore degli employee benefit e offre alle aziende soluzioni digitali per migliorare la qualità di vita e il benessere delle persone che lavorano, dalla pausa pranzo, al tempo libero, fino alla cura della persona e alla mobilità sostenibile.

La nostra piattaforma digitale collega 60 milioni di utenti e oltre 2 milioni di affiliati in 45 Paesi attraverso circa 1 milione di aziende clienti. In Italia, l’ecosistema coinvolge oltre 2,5 milioni di beneficiari, 100 mila aziende clienti e 150 mila partner convenzionati.

Oggi il mondo è cambiato e noi ci impegniamo ad ideare soluzioni sempre più smart per supportare le funzioni HR e rispondere efficacemente alle esigenze correlate alle nuove abitudini lavorative.




“Enrich connections. For good.”, questo il purpose del Gruppo: sviluppare ed arricchire le connessioni per rafforzare le imprese e promuovere soluzioni inclusive, ponendo al centro non solo le persone, ma anche l’ambiente e il territorio.

Per noi, la diversità delle persone è un punto di forza e di ricchezza in grado di riflettere la diversità dei nostri clienti e stakeholder. Siamo inoltre impegnati nella protezione dell’ambiente, disegnando soluzioni spostenibili per la mobilità e lo spreco alimentare con l’impegno di raggiungere le zero emissioni nette entro il 2050.




Edenred è quotata alla Borsa Euronext di Parigi ed è inclusa nei seguenti indici: CAC 40, CAC 40 ESG, CAC Next 20, CAC Large 60, Euronext Tech Leaders, Euronext 100, FTSE4Good e MSCI Europe.

Vuoi sapere di più su di noi? Vai su https://www.edenred.it/




YOU WILL VIBE WITH US

La risorsa ricercata sarà inserita nel team di Business Intelligence & Customer Value Management, riportando direttamente al Head of BI & CVM, e lavorerà a stretto contatto con le diverse business unit.




Principali attività:

Analizzare, modellare e trasformare i dati per supportare le esigenze di reporting e analisi dei diversi stakeholder;
Garantire la qualità, consistenza e affidabilità dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business;
Data Storytelling: sintetizzare i dati, individuare insight rilevanti e presentarli in modo efficace e comprensibile;
Applicare le best practice di modellazione dati e di progettazione architetturale in ambito Business Intelligence.




WE WILL VIBE WITH YOU

Passione per il cliente, rispetto, immaginazione, semplicità e spirito imprenditoriale sono i valori che ricerchiamo nelle nostre persone. Se ti riconosci ed hai voglia di metterti in gioco in un ambiente stimolante e multinazionale inviaci la tua candidatura e diventa anche tu un* Edenreder !

Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria o comprovate competenze equivalenti;
Esperienza di 2 anni in ambito Analytics con tecnologie Microsoft;
Requisiti tecnici: Linguaggio SQL; Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service; DAX, Power Query (M); Utilizzo degli strumenti Microsoft Office 365, in particolare Excel; Concetti base di Data Warehousing (ETL, Stage, DWH) o Data Lakehousing (Medallion Architecture); Concetti base di Data Modeling: star/snowflake schema, relazioni tra tabelle di dimensioni e fatti, misure.




OTHER DETAILS

Contratto: tempo indeterminato
Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
Ticket Restaurant®
Piano Welfare
Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Show more

OTHER DETAILS

  • Contratto: tempo indeterminato
  • Smart-working (10 gg/mese),
  • Ticket Restaurant®
  • Piano Welfare
  • Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa e assicurazione vita professionale/extraprofessionale

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting our in-house digital agency team by analysing and interpreting data to drive strategic decision-making.

Your primary responsibility will be to develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards on PowerBI, providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. You will integrate a data team and collaborate closely with the digital marketing team to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), track campaign performance, and uncover opportunities for optimization.

Youe role in our team




• Collaborate with the digital marketing team to identify data requirements, KPIs, and reporting needs.

• Develop and maintain interactive dashboards on PowerBI to track KPIs, campaign performance and overall business goals.

• Perform in-depth analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.

• Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.

• Create data visualisations, reports, and presentations to effectively communicate findings and recommendations to experts.

• Monitor data quality, identify data discrepancies, and work with relevant teams to ensure data accuracy and consistency.

• Stay up to date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging tools in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

Your profile:




• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

• Proficiency in creating interactive dashboards and reports using PowerBi.

• Knowledge on Python and SQL for data extraction, manipulation and automation is highly desirable.

• Knowledge on Databricks and Microsoft fabric is a plus.

• Familiarity with digital marketing concepts, metrics and platforms (e.g., LinkedIn Ads and Google Analytics) is a plus.

• Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Your benefits

We offer you:

• Possibility of Working from Home – we care about results not locations;

• Training Budget for each employee – we care about the growth of our people;

• Private Health Insurance – we care about health on and off working hours;

• 3 Additional Vacation Days – we care about free time;

• Cooking, sports or book club – we care about spending time with our folks;

• Fresh fruits – we care about your daily dose of vitamins;

• Fresh coffee, tea or water – we care about boosting your day.

• A home for passionate people who innovate, collaborate and love what they do;




An environment where the team thinks and acts entrepreneurial;

An international and dynamic working atmosphere with cross-functional teams;

The opportunity to take more responsibility and develop your career.

Title: Data Analyst E-commerce - Flip.ro
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.




We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro




What you’ll have to do:




Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.




What makes you a good fit:




2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.




What we’ve prepared for you:




The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover




#midsenior




Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results. More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams.


We strongly believe in people's development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to ensure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues and the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst E-Commerce Flip.ro


What you’ll have to do:


  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights across all markets (RO, BG, HU, GR).
  • Develop, automate, and maintain reporting dashboards to support day-to-day operations and strategic projects.
  • Support pricing optimization, inventory management, and category growth initiatives through data-driven analysis.
  • Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Supply Chain teams to evaluate campaign performance and customer behavior.
  • Assist in A/B testing efforts and post-analysis of product, marketing, and operational experiments.
  • Provide recommendations based on analysis to optimize performance and identify new business opportunities.
  • Ensure data quality, governance, and documentation across various analytical workflows.


What makes you a good fit:


  • 2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in E-commerce, Retail, or Technology sectors.
  • Strong skills in SQL, Excel, whilst data visualization tools are a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or similar).
  • Experience with statistical analysis and familiarity with Python or R is a plus.
  • Solid understanding of KPIs related to sales, marketing, and e-commerce operations.
  • Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and the ability to translate complex data into actionable strategies.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Fluency in English; Romanian and/or knowledge of other regional languages is a plus.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • The opportunity to join a startup in hypergrowth which brings a unique learning experience;
  • An important role in shaping and creating the Flip products and services which will impact the lives of millions of consumers in Europe;
  • You will be part of a team that encourages you to be successful and you will enjoy a young and dynamic work environment;
  • Your work will promote a more sustainable economy with an incredible impact in our environment;
  • If physical exercise is what you need, we are ready to offer you a 7card gym access;
  • We really hope that you won't need it, but we have prepared for you a medical subscription @ Regina Maria or Medicover


#midsenior


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details! Also, here you can find our confidentiality policy if you want to consult it.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Conoces DIGI? Somos una compañía de Telecomunicaciones en pleno crecimiento. Durante los últimos años hemos creado más de 8.000 empleos estables, ¿te gustaría ser el/la siguiente en formar parte de la #familiaDIGI?




Buscamos un/a Analista de datos para nuestro departamento de Ingeniería, quien se encargará de las siguientes funciones:

Definir e implementar un sistema de reporting (cuadros de mando, consolidación de resultados, reportes diarios...)
Analizar resultados y proponer mejoras.
Mantenimiento de rutinas en Python.




Para ello, deberá tener Conocimientos avanzados, demostrables y experiencia profesional en:

Programación (Python): dominar los conceptos teóricos de programación, así como los conceptos relacionados de complejidad computacional en Python/.
Microsoft Office (Excel y Power Point).
Manejo y procesamiento de bases de datos.
Análisis de calidad de datos.
Valorable el uso de PowerBI o herramientas de visualización de datos.
Transformación y depuración de datos.
Validación de análisis y modelos previo a su implementación.
Capacidad de exposición y explicación de análisis y resultados.
Conocimientos en algoritmos estadísticos utilizados en aprendizaje automático




¿Te interesa? Inscríbete, ¡te estamos esperando!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Sector: Fintech

Location: Dublin (Hybrid)

Salary: €55,000 – €60,000 plus bonus, health and pension




Our Client

Our client is a Fintech with a strong international footprint and a reputation for delivering intelligent data solutions across the financial services sector. With a focus on innovation, cross-functional collaboration, and operational excellence, they are continually investing in their people and platforms to stay ahead of evolving market demands.




Why should you apply?

This opportunity offers the chance to join a high-performing data team at a critical time of platform enhancement and modernisation. The successful candidate will play a central role in developing high-impact datasets and dashboards that support strategic decision-making. You will gain exposure to leading-edge cloud technologies in a role that balances technical depth with business engagement. The company also promotes flexible work arrangements, excellent learning and development pathways, and a highly supportive team environment.




Who should apply?

This role is ideal for an experienced data professional looking to deepen their analytics expertise in a commercially impactful environment:

At least 3 years of experience in a data analytics or business intelligence role.
Proficient with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Strong SQL skills and exposure to Python, R, or similar.
Experience working with cloud-based data warehousing tools is advantageous.
Able to interpret data meaningfully and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.
Analytical thinker with strong organisational and prioritisation skills.




Role and Reporting Lines

You will report to a senior data leader within a structured analytics function that collaborates across business units. Core responsibilities will include:

Data Architecture – Assist in the design and maintenance of core datasets to support analytics needs.
Visualisation – Create clear, insightful dashboards and performance reports for various teams.
Insight Delivery – Identify trends and deliver actionable insights that guide business strategies.
Data Quality – Support the development of data quality frameworks and conduct regular audits.
Cross-functional Collaboration – Liaise with technology and operations teams to refine data sources and ensure alignment with business goals.
Best Practice – Contribute to the adoption of industry-leading analytics standards.
Training – Educate internal users on data literacy and the use of reporting tools.
Documentation – Maintain structured guidance on processes, governance, and technical configurations.




Interested in this position?

To apply, please submit your CV to Emma Murphy, who is managing this assignment, via the link below.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Westmeath based client is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst coming from a Financial Services / Insurance back ground to join a growing team. This is a permanent role with a requirement of 4 days onsite. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Key Responsibilities

Transform data into meaningful information and actionable insight.
Use a variety of tools and query methods to analyse data and identify opportunities and solutions.
Act as a link between data engineering and visualisation teams to maximise the use and accessibility of data across the business.
Present analytical findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Enhance automated reporting with added insight that drives action and business value.
Support a culture shift towards data-informed decision making.
Help design and embed strong data management and reporting standards.
Contribute to data governance practices and ensure consistent application of analytics methodologies.
Develop and promote standardised approaches to data use and interpretation.




Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 5 years of experience in data analysis and reporting.
Proficiency in SQL for querying, mining, and segmenting data.
Strong quantitative analysis skills with experience deriving insights from data.
At least 2 years of experience with tools such as R or Python.
Good understanding of database structures and data architecture.
Familiarity with BI strategies and their application in a business setting.
Experience with tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Experience in financial services; insurance sector experience is a strong advantage.




Personal Attributes

Independent and experienced subject matter expert with the ability to work autonomously and deliver best practice solutions.
Positive, can-do attitude and the ability to quickly grasp new business and technical environments.
Strong relationship-building skills and the ability to confidently manage stakeholder expectations, including those at an executive level.




Skills:

Data Analyst Data Insights Data Analysis Reporting SQL Python Tableau

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into Head of Data Management you will deliver critical management information and analysis to allow our data managers identify data quality enhancements, monitor data usage and track supplier royalty costs. The quality of the analysis is of utmost importance, and decisions will be taken off the back of it. Alongside this you will directly manage a portfolio of data assets, with responsibility for the daily management including engaging with Product teams and the wider Experian UK&I business.

What You'll Do


End-to-End accountability for a nominated set of data assets throughout data lifecycle.
Maintain governance documentation (e.g. Record of Compliance, Data Handshakes) up to date.
Championing a culture that achieves goals, delights customers and keeps consumer advocacy at the heart of everything that Experian does.
Be the subject matter expert (SME) for your nominated data assets, supporting internal stakeholders looking for input, advice and granular detail.
Lead by example and follow all regulatory requirements and applying appropriate controls.
Support Data Owners with the curation of Management Information (MI) to ensure informed decisions around data usage, including trends and broader analysis.
Support regular MI requests for existing Data Office forums including Data Asset Reviews (DARs), Risk Management Meeting (RMG).
Ensure MI delivery is tested and validated to high level of accuracy.
Embrace your own curiosity around data, to highlight additional trends/insight to support better decisions.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Around 3 years of experience in a role which involves data management, manipulation or visualisation.
Experience with data manipulation tools such as SQL or Snowflake and/or data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to create dashboards that bring the data to life.
Education degree in Data, Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
Excellent written and verbal English.
Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices, deliverables and techniques for implementing enhanced data processing applications into a production environment, including knowledge of the data lifecycle stages.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***Relocation opportunity to Germany***




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (Hybrid – 3 days a week)




We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join my client's dynamic Product team. In this role, you’ll analyze user behavior to generate insights, support A/B testing, and deliver actionable data to drive product enhancements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze user behavior to generate actionable product insights
Support A/B testing from setup to analysis
Monitor data to identify trends, anomalies, and test outcomes
Deliver datasets to support data-driven features
Work on core product areas: search, homepage, filters, and map experience
Contribute to projects exploring AI tools, including AI-powered search features
Focused on improving product and user experience




Essential Skills:

Strong attitude and willingness to learn
Experience with R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, BigQuery
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience with A/B testing
Exposure to consumer-facing apps
Comfortable working with B2B tech products
At least 2 years of Data Analyst experience (open to more experience)




Benefits:

Personalized coaching, free online learning courses, and access to a fully equipped campus library
Relocation and visa support for Germany
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours
Daily canteen lunch, free drinks, and snacks
Health insurance, pension plan
Free on-campus gym and much more!




If you are interested and fit the bill, please apply today as we are scheduling interviews immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

  • User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
  • Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
  • Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
  • Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.


Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.


Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

  • Strong proficiency in and .
  • Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
  • Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
  • Experience in a SaaS environment


Education & Experience:

  • Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

  • Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
  • Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.


What’s Offered

  • A competitive salary based on experience.
  • 25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
  • A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
  • Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
  • A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
  • Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
  • Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Somos Métrica, una consultora de negocio, integración de sistemas, servicios y soluciones IT, comprometida con la Sociedad de la información y el desarrollo tecnológico.

¿Te apasiona trabajar con datos, automatizar procesos y ser parte de proyectos que realmente aportan valor?

En Métrica estamos buscando a alguien como tú: curioso, con mentalidad analítica y muchas ganas de crecer. Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo un/a Data Analyst con entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia para colaborar en un proyecto puntero con un cliente referente en el sector.

Desde el primer día formarás parte de un entorno colaborativo donde tus ideas cuentan. Estarás acompañado por profesionales expertos que te guiarán y te ayudarán a potenciar tu carrera.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?

🔍 Experiencia en desarrollo de pipelines ETL con Apache Spark y Python.

☁️ Conocimiento práctico de servicios AWS como S3, RDS (PostgreSQL), IAM, Glue, EMR y Lambda.

🧠 Buen dominio de SQL.

🔧 Familiaridad con herramientas de control de versiones y flujos CI/CD.

⚡ Se valorará experiencia con procesamiento de datos en tiempo real.

📜 Certificaciones AWS en datos o arquitecturas cloud (deseable).

💹 Conocimientos en inversiones y banca privada (deseable).

🌍 Nivel de inglés intermedio o superior (deseable).

¿Qué te ofrecemos? 😎

📰 Contrato indefinido desde el inicio.

🏥 Acceso a un plan de retribución flexible.

👩‍🎓 Formación continua en las áreas que te interesen.

👨‍💻 Modalidad 100% remoto: trabaja desde donde estés.




En Métrica queremos ayudarte a dar el siguiente paso en tu carrera.

📧 ¡Contáctanos o envíanos tu CV!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Mit Grundkenntnissen in der Luftfahrt




WePlan ist ein innovatives Unternehmen, das wegweisende Lösungen für die strategische und mehrjährige Personalplanung entwickelt. Mit unserem derzeitigen Kundenstamm in der Reise-, Transport- und Logistikbranche wachsen wir stetig und erweitern kontinuierlich unser Netzwerk. Dafür suchen wir motivierte Teamplayer, die mit uns gemeinsam die Zukunft gestalten möchten.




Deine Aufgaben:




Datenanalyse: Erstelle und pflege Dashboards sowie Berichte, um unseren Kunden datenbasierte Einblicke zu bieten
Optimierung: Analysiere komplexe Datenstrukturen und leite Handlungsempfehlungen zur Optimierung der Personalplanung ab
Entwicklung: Wirke bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenmodellen mit, die unsere Prozesse verbessern
Ad-hoc-Analysen: Unterstütze Entscheidungsprozesse durch die Durchführung spezifischer Datenanalysen
Zusammenarbeit: Arbeite eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um Datenbedürfnisse zu identifizieren und innovative Lösungen zu entwickeln




Dein Profil:




Akademischer Hintergrund: Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen Bereich
Praktische Erfahrung: Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise mit Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI
Excel-Expertise: Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel, ergänzt durch SQL-Kenntnisse; Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Teamorientierung: Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen und dynamischen Team




Was wir bieten:




Flexibles Arbeiten: Möglichkeit, überwiegend remote zu arbeiten (4 Tage pro Woche)
Zentrale Lage: Unser Büro befindet sich im Herzen von Frankfurt, mit Zugang zu Open Office Spaces in ganz Deutschland
Attraktive Vorteile: Genieße ein kostenloses Ticket für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr, kostenlose Getränke und exklusive Catering-Angebote
Top-Ausstattung: Wir stellen die neueste Apple-Hardware bereit und bieten zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung




Bewirb dich jetzt!




Wenn du Teil eines innovativen Teams werden und zur Entwicklung wegweisender Lösungen beitragen möchtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Show more

Title: Analista dati
Description:
Azienda & Valori:

Il nostro cliente è una multinazionale leader nel settore oil & gas, con una presenza consolidata a livello globale. La sede italiana, situata in Milano, zona centrale, è il cuore delle operazioni commerciali e amministrative del gruppo per l'Europa. L'azienda promuove un ambiente di lavoro dinamico, innovativo e inclusivo, con un forte focus sulla crescita e lo sviluppo delle competenze dei propri dipendenti.




Titolo della posizione:

Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale (M/F/D)




Finalità del Ruolo:

Il Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale avrà la responsabilità di gestire l’inserimento e la validazione dei dati commerciali e di supportare l’analisi dei dati per il monitoraggio delle performance aziendali. Il candidato sarà il punto di riferimento per la gestione delle informazioni legate ai dati di vendita e ai report commerciali, lavorando a stretto contatto con il team vendite e l’area finance. Sarà cruciale l’abilità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight utili per ottimizzare le strategie commerciali.




Tasks:

• Inserire, validare e aggiornare i dati relativi alle vendite e ai clienti all'interno del sistema gestionale aziendale, garantendo accuratezza e tempestività.

• Utilizzare Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato, con una solida padronanza di tabelle pivot, funzioni avanzate e macro per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati.

• Creare e aggiornare report commerciali periodici, monitorando le performance di vendita, il raggiungimento degli obiettivi e i KPI.

• Collaborare con il team commerciale per l’analisi delle previsioni di vendita e l’andamento dei mercati, supportando la definizione di strategie di miglioramento.

• Identificare anomalie o discrepanze nei dati, proponendo soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza del processo di data entry e di analisi.

• Supportare il team nella gestione di grandi volumi di dati, provenienti da diverse fonti, e nella loro integrazione in report consolidati.

• Partecipare alla creazione di dashboard interattive utilizzando strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI o Tableau, per fornire visualizzazioni intuitive e dinamiche delle informazioni aziendali.

• Fornire insight utili e proposte basate sui dati per ottimizzare le strategie di vendita e migliorare l’efficienza operativa.




Relazioni funzionali:

Interne: Collaborazione diretta con il team vendite, l'area finance e il reparto IT per la gestione dei dati e dei flussi di informazioni.
Esterne: Occasionali interazioni con partner esterni o fornitori di software per l'integrazione di nuove soluzioni di analisi e data entry.




Funzioni Primarie:

• Inserimento, gestione e validazione dei dati commerciali.

• Creazione e aggiornamento di report commerciali e analisi delle performance di vendita.

• Collaborazione con il team vendite per l’ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali.

• Utilizzo avanzato di Excel, con particolare focus su tabelle pivot, macro e funzioni avanzate.

• Utilizzo di strumenti di business intelligence per la creazione di dashboard e visualizzazioni dati.




Formazione e Competenze:

Il candidato ideale possiede una Laurea in Data Analytics, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini. È richiesta una solida esperienza nell’uso di Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato e di strumenti di data analysis. La familiarità con strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti costituisce un plus, così come l’esperienza nella gestione di dati in contesti aziendali complessi.




Hard Skills:

• Competenze avanzate nell'uso di Microsoft Excel (tabelle pivot, macro, funzioni avanzate).

• Capacità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight strategici.

• Esperienza nella creazione di report commerciali e nella gestione dei KPI.

• Conoscenza di strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.

• Competenze nel data entry e nella validazione dei dati.

• Esperienza nell’automazione dei processi di analisi e reporting.




Soft Skills:

• Eccellenti capacità di analisi e problem-solving.

• Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli nella gestione dei dati.

• Ottime capacità di collaborazione e comunicazione con team interni.

• Proattività nel migliorare processi e flussi di lavoro.

• Flessibilità e capacità di adattamento in un ambiente dinamico e in costante evoluzione.




Cosa Offre il nostro Committente:

L'azienda offre un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e un ambiente di lavoro flessibile e innovativo:

• RAL fino a 35.000€: La retribuzione annua lorda massima prevista è di 35.000€, commisurata all’esperienza del candidato.

• Smart Working 2 giorni a settimana: Possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida, garantendo un equilibrio tra vita privata e lavorativa.

• Assicurazione Sanitaria Fondo Est: Copertura sanitaria estesa per il benessere del dipendente.

• Ticket Restaurant: Buoni pasto giornalieri da 9€ per ogni giorno lavorato.

• Accesso al welfare aziendale: Iniziative e programmi di welfare volti a migliorare la qualità della vita lavorativa.

• Formazione Continua: Opportunità di crescita e aggiornamento delle competenze, con accesso a percorsi di formazione e sviluppo professionale.




L'offerta è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, nonché a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

I dati personali saranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (GDPR) e della normativa nazionale vigente in materia di protezione dei dati personali. Il trattamento dei dati avverrà con modalità e strumenti idonei a garantire la riservatezza e la sicurezza degli stessi, secondo le finalità indicate nell’informativa privacy che sarà fornita ai candidati. Inviando il proprio curriculum vitae, il candidato autorizza espressamente il trattamento dei dati ai sensi della suddetta normativa e dichiara di aver preso visione dell’informativa sulla privacy.

Title: Business Data Analyst (FTC)
Description:
Uniphar - Who We Are

With 3,000+ employees across Ireland, the UK, Europe, MENA, and the U.S., Uniphar partners with 200+ top pharmaco-medical manufacturers, delivering specialised, tech-enabled solutions through its three divisions: Medtech, Supply Chain & Retail, and Pharma.

This opportunity sits within Uniphar Medtech, a dedicated division focused on delivering innovative medical technologies and solutions.

Purpose of the Role

Business Data Analyst, Uniphar Medtech.

Please note this is a fixed term contract role for 11 months.

Uniphar Medtech recognise data as a key business asset.

The data analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, analysing, interpreting and communicating actionable data insights (anomalies, trends, patterns) to commercial and operations teams through reports, visualisations and presentations. The insights will inform and drive business improvement efforts.

The business data analyst will use data extraction, analysis and presentation tools such as Python, Jet Reporting, Jet Analytics, Power BI and AI to deliver on the above responsibilities.

The data analyst will support many business units (BUs) across Medtech.

Key Duties And Responsibilities

This job description is not an exhaustive list but provides an indication of the main duties and responsibilities of the position.


Collaborate with requestors to design, develop and implement data reports and visualizations to communicate data insights to commercial and operations teams with drill down capability by BU (turn raw data into information)
Develop and maintain data reports and visualisations (to include dashboards) to enable self-service by end users (in time)
Generate, monitor and analyse key process and performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for business improvement
Collaborate with end users to identify key business questions to help provide actionable insights to support business decision making
Stay up to date with the latest data extraction, analysis (to include AI) and visualization techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights
Support ERP project team with the migration of key reports, metrics and dashboards onto the new ERP system that is planned.
Use of SQL, Python or equivalent to extract, clean and analyse datasets from various data sources



Role Requirements

Essential:


Hold a valid working permit (if applicable)
Full Clean Driving license
Good oral and written communications skills
Good numerical skills
General computer skills
Good organisational skills
Good understanding of health and safety issues
Team player be able to interact with all staff at all levels
Good attention to detail
Good process development and problem-solving skills



Desirable:


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data analysis, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
Strong data extraction SQL, Python or other extraction tool skills, with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, preferably Power BI
Experience with reporting/analysis tools such as Jet Reporting/Jet Analytics
2-3 years of experience in a data analysis role with demonstrated business improvements from data insights communicated
Strong analytical skills with a passion for solving complex problems with data insights
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes


Please note we cannot assist with any visa sponsorship and candidates must have the correct visa to live and work in Ireland.

Why work with us

Our core values, titled our Medtech Mindset, guides our culture and work environment:


We Go Forward Together: We operate as a unified team, leveraging diverse specialties to make swift, collaborative decisions and embrace progress over perfection
We Take Our Business Seriously: We prioritise compliance and risk management to ensure the best outcomes for our patients and partners, supported by our innovative portfolio and commitment to sustainability
We Deliver Exceptional Results: We focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and commercial success to achieve outstanding results for our patients, customers, and business


If you have similar values and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team and help us drive forward together.
Show more

This job description is not an exhaustive list but provides an indication of the main duties and responsibilities of the position.

  • Collaborate with requestors to design, develop and implement data reports and visualizations to communicate data insights to commercial and operations teams with drill down capability by BU (turn raw data into information)
  • Develop and maintain data reports and visualisations (to include dashboards) to enable self-service by end users (in time)
  • Generate, monitor and analyse key process and performance metrics (KPIs) to identify trends, patterns and opportunities for business improvement
  • Collaborate with end users to identify key business questions to help provide actionable insights to support business decision making
  • Stay up to date with the latest data extraction, analysis (to include AI) and visualization techniques and tools to continuously improve data insights
  • Support ERP project team with the migration of key reports, metrics and dashboards onto the new ERP system that is planned.
  • Use of SQL, Python or equivalent to extract, clean and analyse datasets from various data sources


Role Requirements

Essential:

  • Hold a valid working permit (if applicable)
  • Full Clean Driving license
  • Good oral and written communications skills
  • Good numerical skills
  • General computer skills
  • Good organisational skills
  • Good understanding of health and safety issues
  • Team player be able to interact with all staff at all levels
  • Good attention to detail
  • Good process development and problem-solving skills


Desirable:

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data analysis, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or economics or proven background in the area of data analysis or similar field
  • Strong data extraction SQL, Python or other extraction tool skills, with a proven ability to manipulate large datasets
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView, preferably Power BI
  • Experience with reporting/analysis tools such as Jet Reporting/Jet Analytics
  • 2-3 years of experience in a data analysis role with demonstrated business improvements from data insights communicated
  • Strong analytical skills with a passion for solving complex problems with data insights
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
  • A passion for improving customer experience and driving business outcomes

Please note we cannot assist with any visa sponsorship and candidates must have the correct visa to live and work in Ireland.

Why work with us

Our core values, titled our Medtech Mindset, guides our culture and work environment:

  • We Go Forward Together: We operate as a unified team, leveraging diverse specialties to make swift, collaborative decisions and embrace progress over perfection
  • We Take Our Business Seriously: We prioritise compliance and risk management to ensure the best outcomes for our patients and partners, supported by our innovative portfolio and commitment to sustainability
  • We Deliver Exceptional Results: We focus on quality, customer satisfaction, and commercial success to achieve outstanding results for our patients, customers, and business

If you have similar values and are passionate about making a meaningful impact, we invite you to join our team and help us drive forward together.

Title: Junior Data Analyst

Strong SQL, Power BI & Python
Dynamic, high-calibre team
Global FinTech with real growth opportunities




*All the candidates must have either a STAMP 4 visa or an EU Passport*




Join a global FinTech known for its innovative approach, dynamic environment, and top-tier talent. You’ll be part of a high-performing team at the forefront of the company’s international expansion.




This is the perfect opportunity for a junior Data Analyst ready to take the next big step. You’ll develop your skills in SQL, Power BI, and Python while supporting business stakeholders across global markets.




You’ll work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment that values innovation, supports your growth, and gives you all the tools you need to build a rewarding career in data analytics.




What’s in for you:

High-calibre, international FinTech
Modern tools – SQL, Power BI & Python
Exposure to global data and reporting
Provide critical input
Fast-track your career growth
High visibility in key business units
Supportive and driven culture
Clear development path and upskilling opportunities




Skills/Experience:

3+ years’ experience in data analysis
Proficiency in advanced SQL queries
Experience building reports and dashboards with Power BI




Salary / Remuneration:

€40,000 - €50,000

+ 10% bonus, health care, and pension contribution!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Only candidates with INSURANCE industry experience will be considered for this role







Are you ready to turn complex data into powerful insights that shape strategic decisions? A leading insurance client of ours is seeking a skilled and driven Data Analyst to join their high-performing IT team. We are looking at candidates that have insurance experience and are truly passionate about data!




Responsibilities

Analyze data sets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights, delivering clear and compelling reports to stakeholders
Design, develop, and maintain complex queries and reporting tools across various platforms
Produce scheduled and ad hoc reports tailored to the needs of internal teams and external partners
Maintain and enhance the current reporting suite, ensuring accuracy and relevance of filters and datasets
Collaborate closely with business teams to support data-driven strategy and forecasting
Partner with senior leadership to prioritize data initiatives and align reporting with business goals
Act as the main point of contact for third-party service providers and capital partners, attending relevant meetings and calls
Continuously seek out process improvements to enhance efficiency and data quality across reporting systems




Candidate Requirements

3+ years of experience in the Analytics space
Proven commercial experience within the Insurance industry is essential
Proven track record in SQL query writing for reporting and ad hoc data exploration
Advanced skills in reporting tools such as Power BI, SSRS, and Excel (including Macros)
Solid understanding of the data lifecycle, with the ability to manage and optimize data in SQL databases
Exceptional analytical thinking, with the ability to explain insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills, comfortable engaging with executives and external partners

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for a Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNP Paribas internal or external clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.
Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Creative descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder’s decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting, and data mining.




Requirements:

Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development
Database Management (SQL)
Methodologies (Agile)
Office Pack (MS Excel)
Power BI / Tableau
English required, both spoken and written.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com or with reference “DataAnalyst”.




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hey! We're Plum, your smart saving and investing app on a mission to help grow money for life. Whether you're stashing the cash for tea and toast in your first home or catching some rays during retirement, Plum's got your back.

Since 2016, over 2 million people in 10 European markets have set aside more than £2 billion with our clever automation and AI - that's the magic of Plum! As recognition for our work, we've received awards from the likes of Deloitte, Finder, and more.

That's all down to our passionate team of 200+ Plumsters, who work around Europe to help us achieve our mission. And now we're looking for more brilliant people to join us on our journey.

About The Role

We are looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the team and help expand the value we deliver across Plum.

You will be part of a well established Product Analytics team, consisting of Data Analysts embedded across Product, Marketing and Operations, supporting the companies decision making through data.

What Will You Do


Become domain expert across an area at Plum, establishing yourself as the point of contact for analytical support
Help the teams you work with identify the opportunities (new features, products, bugs etc) they should focus on, by linking these to impact on the metrics of interest
Propose and define success KPIs and guide the teams towards data-driven decision making around these
Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers and Marketeers at Plum to impact size opportunities and estimate the impact these had once released
Produce deep dive analysis that influence the trajectory of the team's roadmap
Data modelling and analysis of key concepts, KPIs and patterns using dbt, BigQuery and SQL
Create interactive and informative dashboards and reports in Looker
Plan, implement, and analyse A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new product features against KPIs
Most importantly, you will have the opportunity to work on a modern Data platform (BigQuery, Looker, dbt), surrounded by an eclectic team of great Data professionals covering areas such as Product Analytics, Data Science and Data & Analytics Engineering



Who You Are


You have strong analytical intuition with a demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and extract actionable insights from data
You demonstrate ability to work independently and with rigour, whilst optimising for impact
You can collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams (Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing), translating business requirements into strong technical solutions
You value attention to detail and know how to balance quality and speed
You are impact driven, love a challenge, and have a self-starter mindset
You're team-oriented, keen to share your knowledge and grow professionally
Previous experience on Fintech, B2C digital businesses and/or fast-paced scale-up environments is very valued



Plum's Perks


Own part of the company you're helping grow through stock options
Private health insurance
Annual training budget
Plum Premium for free
Competitive referral scheme
Flexible approach to remote working: we encourage at least 2 days a week in one of our beautiful offices in London, Athens or Cyprus
Team breakfasts and team lunches
25 days holiday + bank holidays
45 work-from-anywhere days to give you flexibility to work your way
2 weeks sabbatical after 4 years to take the break you deserve
Enhanced parental leave
1 paid volunteering day annually
Annual team trip to a surprise destination!
A fun, inclusive company culture (think 🦄🌈💯)


If you think this sounds like a bit of you then don't hesitate to get in touch!

Thanks,

Plum Τeam 💜


Plum is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Plum does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need
Show more
