Title: Intern Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

At IKEA, we do things a little differently. We think differently, act differently, and work differently as well. We like to break things—like rules—and then make things, like music-playing lamps and beds disguised as sofas. It’s all part of our vision: to create a better everyday life for the many people. By 2030, we hope to help millions more look forward to going home. Maybe you can help us? 

About The Area 

Core Business Retail Concept is dedicated to protecting, expanding, and developing the IKEA Concept and the IKEA Brand in both existing and new markets. This includes sharing IKEA knowledge and learning across the franchise system.  Retail Concept consists of the following areas: Brand & Marketing, Expansion, Learning, Retail Experience and Retail Concept Operations.  

About The Assignment 

We offer unique IKEA specialist competence in developing, improving, designing, establishing, and operating IKEA Customer Meeting Points based on a market approach across all IKEA markets. Customer Meeting Points include IKEA Stores, Small Stores, Pick-up & Points, Plan Shops, and Plan & Order Points. We coach, mentor, support, and challenge IKEA retailers in their expansion plans and collaborate with our IKEA franchisees in over 50 countries worldwide. We thrive in a multicultural environment where we comfortably use English (spoken and written) to communicate. We co-create and innovate IKEA retail architecture, transforming market and business needs into outstanding customer experiences. 

Do you want to take part in supporting the designing of IKEA customer meeting places worldwide through the analysis, presentation and clear sharing of data and information? Would you like to work in an open-minded and international environment? Then we are looking for you! 

About The Role 

We are looking for a data analyst intern for a 12-month period at our office in Malmö, starting September 2025. During your internship, you will be a member of our Process, Service and Tools team.

Your tasks will include: 


Working with our CMP dimensioning team to collate, analyze and share physical CMP design and As Built data. (CMP dimensioning is our team and digital tool which supports the sizing and allocation of spaces within an IKEA CMP based on market and business needs)
Work with and support in the capacity planning and forecasting for incoming projects and internal resources.
Provide business support to projects which develop our service offer for CMP design to our franchisees


About You 

We believe that you are newly graduated from university studies within for example business, data analysis, statistics or other relevant degrees and are eager to start your first job in the field.

You are a driven person with a genuine interest in exploring, understanding and sharing business data and analysis in a clear way and are able to clearly demonstrate this by giving examples. You have strong interpersonal skills and find it easy to build relationships and earn trust, embodying IKEA values. You take responsibility for actions and results, making things happen. You should have: 


At least 3 years of study within relevant degrees related to the role 
An interest in retail design across various scale projects. 
Good skills in understanding and communicating data and its usability and impact on end users. 
Strong social skills and the ability to work independently. 
Fluency in English (spoken and written). 
Experience working with excel based systems, project and resource management tools


You would benefit most from this internship if you are a proactive person, as this role will allow you to take on more responsibilities as you demonstrate your capability. 

Additional Information

This role is full-time temporary employment and based in Malmö, Sweden. You will report to Process and Service Manager. If you would like to know more about the role, please connect with jim.gardner@inter.ikea.com, or if you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with recruiter linnea.dietrichson@inter.ikea.com 

Interested? 

Submit your CV and motivational letter by 23rd of May 2025. We truly want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at Inter IKEA and why you would be a great fit for this role. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means we may close the application process earlier if we find the right candidate. Don’t hesitate, submit your application as soon as possible.  We look forward to receiving your application in English! 
Show more

If you would like to know more about the role, please connect with jim.gardner@inter.ikea.com, or if you have questions about the recruitment process, please connect with recruiter linnea.dietrichson@inter.ikea.com 

Interested? 

Submit your CV and motivational letter by 23rd of May 2025. We truly want to get to know you, so make sure you tell us why you want to work at Inter IKEA and why you would be a great fit for this role. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means we may close the application process earlier if we find the right candidate. Don’t hesitate, submit your application as soon as possible.  We look forward to receiving your application in English!

Title: Analista de dados Junior
Description:
Na IRIUMqueremos que persigas sempre os teus sonhos! Aqui, prepara-te para conquistares as tuas metas, enquanto desfrutas do caminho.

Atualmente encontramo-nos à procura deAnalista de dados Junior:

Requisitos:


Acompanhar e monitorizar a performance de operações, de forma a assegurar a qualidade do serviço prestado end-to-end
Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e. controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.)
Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados
Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede
Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade
Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, i.e, atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos
Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade
Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento. Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel);
Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua Inglesa;
Conhecimentos de POWER BI

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Client's team on a hybrid working model from Lisbon.




Position Overview

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in providing data analysis and reporting tools to teams like VERDI. Your responsibilities will include data extraction, processing, and delivery to support decision-making and enhance the user experience. This collaborative role will involve working closely with teams to ensure high data quality while addressing recurring and ad hoc business needs.




Key Responsibilities

Build and optimize ETL data pipelines using Apache Airflow.
Fine-tune SQL queries and Python scripts for enhanced performance.
Generate actionable insights and identify emerging trends through data analysis.
Deliver data outputs in an attractive and functional format for stakeholders.
Understand business requirements and assess their impacts to guide data solutions.
Continuously ensure the accuracy and quality of data and provide ongoing support to the team.




Required Skills

Advanced Python for scripting and analytics 🐍.
Advanced SQL with Oracle (mandatory); SQL Server and PostgreSQL (preferred).
Experience with PySpark and Data Warehouses.
Familiarity with Agile (SCRUM) methodologies.
Knowledge of Apache Airflow (desired).
Fluent English (mandatory).




Bonus Skills:

Version control with GIT.
Experience with Parquet file format.
Ability to create APIs in Python.




Why Join Us?

Employment: Indefinite Contract from the start.
Health Insurance: Comprehensive coverage for your well-being.
Hybrid Work Model: 2 days on-site, 3 days remote.
Continuous Learning: Access to a Udemy Business subscription with thousands of workshops and courses.
Team Culture: Collaborative and innovative work environment.




If you meet the above criteria and are ready for an exciting opportunity in a dynamic environment, submit your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ( 1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Lisbon (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a Middle Data Analyst to join our analytics team. You will help us understand and improve our promo campaigns. If you have experience in iGaming or Betting, know how to use analytics tools, and understand business needs — we would be happy to see you in our team.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience in a casino or betting company (optional: mobile games with P2W model or traffic acquisition);
  • Good skills in SQL, AWS (Athena, S3), Tableau (Desktop and Prep), Excel, and Google Sheets;
  • Experience working with DWH or backend teams, and with product managers;
  • Experience with B2B business models or understanding how they work is a plus;
  • Practical knowledge of Google Analytics and Python;
  • Good communication and organizational skills;
  • Optional: experience in A/B testing;
  • English level: B1


Responsibilities

  • Make reports and analysis for promo campaigns;
  • Work closely with the product analytics team;
  • Organize and lead weekly meetings with promo team managers to show and explain campaign results;
  • Do ad-hoc analysis and create visual reports;
  • Write short and clear documentation in Confluence about your analysis and methods


Benefits

🎰 Be part of the international iGaming industry - Work with a top European solution provider and shape the future of online gaming;

💕 A Collaborative Culture - Join a supportive and understanding team;

💰 Competitive salary and bonus system - Enjoy additional rewards on top of your base salary;

📆 Unlimited vacation & sick leave - Because we prioritize your well-being;

📈 Professional Development - Access a dedicated budget for self-development and learning;

🏥 Healthcare coverage - Available for employees in Ukraine and compensation across the EU;

🫂 Mental health support - Free consultations with a corporate psychologist;

🇬🇧 Language learning support - We cover the cost of foreign language courses;

🎁 Celebrating Your Milestones - Special gifts for life's important moments;

⏳ Flexible working hours - Start your day anytime between 9:00-11:00 AM;

🏢 Flexible Work Arrangements - Choose between remote, office, or hybrid work;

🖥 Modern Tech Setup - Get the tools you need to perform at your best;

🚚 Relocation support - Assistance provided if you move to one of our hubs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stokke – Here We Grow:

With over eight decades of history, Stokke was founded on Norway’s west coast in 1932. Deeply rooted in Scandinavian heritage, our brand is built on principles of quality, craftsmanship, and family connection. For more than 40 years, Stokke has delivered iconic and innovative solutions for children—products that are not only beautifully designed but made to nurture family bonding and support child development.

With global offices in Norway, The Netherlands, the U.S., Germany, France, and Asia, Stokke offers a truly international work environment, committed to shaping a better world through confident kids.







Take Responsibility – The Position:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Global E-Commerce team. This role is key to unlocking the power of data across our e-commerce operations. You will analyze and interpret data from multiple sources, design and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI, and generate insights that support data-driven decision-making

.You will also play a central role in data governance and drive the continuous improvement of data usage and visualization across teams. With a digital-first focus, you will help track and analyze website user behavior, contributing to optimizations that enhance the online customer experience and drive growth.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis & Visualization

Analyze large datasets from various digital and business sources to derive strategic and operational insights
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards for internal stakeholders
Create reporting frameworks and data models that support business decision-making




Digital Analytics & Web Tracking

Collaborate with eCommerce and digital marketing teams to track and interpret website and user behavior
Provide recommendations for website optimization based on behavioral and performance data
Support tagging and tracking implementation across digital platforms




Data Governance & Quality Assurance

Support the implementation and enforcement of data governance standards
Conduct data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of insights
Troubleshoot data issues in collaboration with IT and development teams




Cross-Functional Collaboration

Partner with global and regional teams in eCommerce, Marketing, and IT to support data needs
Present findings in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help build a data-driven culture through education and knowledge sharing




Better Together: The Ideal Profile:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, IT, or a related field
3–4 years of relevant experience, preferably in the eCommerce industry
Proficiency in Power BI and the ability to create engaging, insight-driven dashboards
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, business modeling, and economics
Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
Experience working in interdisciplinary and international teams is an advantage
Analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Strong sense of ownership and autonomy in problem-solving
A passion for continuous improvement and cross-functional collaboration
Ability to manage multiple data sources and ensure consistency and accuracy in reporting




Keep Growing – What We Offer:

A chance to work with a globally recognized premium brand with a strong mission and purpose
A dynamic, hybrid international work environment located in Amsterdam
Exposure to cutting-edge digital analytics platforms and tools
The opportunity to help shape the future of Stokke’s eCommerce and digital performance strategy
A collaborative culture that supports continuous learning, development, and innovation

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Would you like to build a career in a leading multinational IT company?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team.

Since 2007, MMDSmart has been a leading supplier in cloud communications, delivering game-changing IT products to businesses in over 100 countries. Our success is fueled by the inspiration and innovative ideas of our team members, encouraging their growth and impacting our Messaging and Voice solutions. These empower our clients to communicate more effectively with their customers. Don't miss this chance to excel in a rapidly expanding tech company, where your potential and ambitions are not just recognized, but celebrated.

Requirements

What will you do at MMDSmart?

  • Develop and support analytical systems for operational analysis and decision making;
  • Communicate with Business Process Owners, identifying KPIs;
  • Communicate with development teams to identify data sources, data lifecycle analysis;
  • Developing the data storage structure in DWH, setting requirements for the Data;
  • Engineer about the ETL process, and checking the results;
  • Developing dashboards in analytical platforms;
  • Presenting analytical results to customers.


You are a perfect match if you have:

  • 1+ years of experience as Data/Product/Business/BI analyst;
  • Understanding the principles of business process analysis, KPI identification;
  • 1+ years of experience in DataViz platforms: Tableau/Looker/SuperSet;
  • Knowledge of programming: SQL, Python +, database principles;
  • An analytical mind, communication and presentation skills, and teamwork skills;
  • Fluent Russian.


Benefits

Why do talents choose and stay at MMDSmart?

Embrace the opportunity to work in a company that cares about:

Your Wellness: Access to mental health programs, comprehensive medical insurance, and a sports card*.

Your Happiness: Enjoy the company of cool teammates, a friendly atmosphere, a strong mentorship, and a variety of bonuses & corporate gifts.

Your Development: Benefit from free educational events & courses, and English classes with native speakers.

Your Career: Focus on your professional development in a supportive environment.

Work-Life Balance: Choose your working format - remote, office-based, or hybrid and engage in team-building activities.

Think this role's got your name on it? Go ahead and apply, we'd love to see what you've got!

Equal-Opportunity Employment

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

  • Medical Insurance and Sport Card perks are available for employees located in Bulgaria

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
About CARMA

CARMA is the world's most advanced research and intelligence company, specializing in comprehensive media monitoring and analysis services. We combine cutting-edge technology with extensive data collection to deliver actionable insights and customized media solutions.

· Our proprietary crawler processes millions of global content pieces every day in over 100 languages, across all types of media.

· Through our strategic, hands-on approach, we help brands maintain a strong global presence and sustain their market position in the ever-evolving PR and media landscape.




About the Role:

At CARMA, we are looking for an experienced Insights Analyst to Analyze media coverage from company monitoring platforms to derive actionable intelligence for clients. Take ownership of the final report quality, ensuring that high standards are met. Continuously enhance the reporting process and overall efficiency to support company objectives and client requirements.




Analysis and Reporting:

Report Ownership: Take full ownership of the final quality of reports, ensuring they meet client standards and expectations.
Media Content Analysis: Analyze media content to extract meaningful insights that support clients' business goals.
High-Quality Reporting: Produce high-quality client reports, both qualitative and quantitative, within tight deadlines. Include tables, charts, summaries, and narratives to clearly present findings.
Ongoing Report Enhancement: seeking feedback from senior insight managers and operational insight managers to improve the reports and team members to continuously improve the reporting process.
Ongoing Process Enhancement: Continuously work on enhancing the reporting process to improve efficiency and profitability.

Additional Duties:

Policy Adherence: Comply with CARMA policies and procedures, supporting the company's mission and vision.
Additional Duties: Perform other job-related tasks as assigned by the direct manager.




Education

BA in Journalism, Business Analytics, Communication, Advertising, Marketing, Public Relations or any related field.




Experience

1 year of experience in an analytical role (including data analysis, market research) within marketing research, media intelligence and data technology, or consulting firm is preferred.

1 year of Market research, data analytics or exposure to traditional and social media is preferred.

Familiar with data visualization and dashboard tools, Microsoft Excel, pivot tables, etc.

Experience in both qualitative and quantitative reporting is preferred.

Show more
HTML:
About CARMA

CARMA is the world's most advanced research and intelligence company, specializing in comprehensive media monitoring and analysis services. We combine cutting-edge technology with extensive data collection to deliver actionable insights and customized media solutions.

· Our proprietary crawler processes millions of global content pieces every day in over 100 languages, across all types of media.

· Through our strategic, hands-on approach, we help brands maintain a strong global presence and sustain their market position in the ever-evolving PR and media landscape.


About the Role:

At CARMA, we are looking for an experienced Insights Analyst to Analyze media coverage from company monitoring platforms to derive actionable intelligence for clients. Take ownership of the final report quality, ensuring that high standards are met. Continuously enhance the reporting process and overall efficiency to support company objectives and client requirements.


Analysis and Reporting:

  • Report Ownership: Take full ownership of the final quality of reports, ensuring they meet client standards and expectations.
  • Media Content Analysis: Analyze media content to extract meaningful insights that support clients' business goals.
  • High-Quality Reporting: Produce high-quality client reports, both qualitative and quantitative, within tight deadlines. Include tables, charts, summaries, and narratives to clearly present findings.
  • Ongoing Report Enhancement: seeking feedback from senior insight managers and operational insight managers to improve the reports and team members to continuously improve the reporting process.
  • Ongoing Process Enhancement: Continuously work on enhancing the reporting process to improve efficiency and profitability.

Additional Duties:

  • Policy Adherence: Comply with CARMA policies and procedures, supporting the company's mission and vision.
  • Additional Duties: Perform other job-related tasks as assigned by the direct manager.


Education

BA in Journalism, Business Analytics, Communication, Advertising, Marketing, Public Relations or any related field.


Experience

1 year of experience in an analytical role (including data analysis, market research) within marketing research, media intelligence and data technology, or consulting firm is preferred.

1 year of Market research, data analytics or exposure to traditional and social media is preferred.

Familiar with data visualization and dashboard tools, Microsoft Excel, pivot tables, etc.

Experience in both qualitative and quantitative reporting is preferred.

As a Data Analyst, you’ll play a key role in empowering stakeholders with the insights they need to drive impactful decisions. You’ll sharpen your expertise in advanced SQL, Power BI, and Python to focus on data analysis, reporting, and automation.

Title: Product Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst (f/m/x) to join our Tech - Retail Team, that is responsible for maintaining, optimizing and expending our B2C/retail platform: Autohero in our AUTO1.comTechnology Department. In this Department we disrupt the used car market using cutting-edge technology. As AUTO1.com, a fast growing brand, we are part of AUTO1 Group, Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We are revolutionizing B2B automotive retail through the simplest processes and a digital infrastructure.

Job Description


Work closely with the product management team to track feature success metrics
Understand the functionality of our online platforms by reviewing product and technical requirements
Conduct independent analyses to support the product management team with actionable user behavior and business insights
Perform regular checks to ensure data integrity
Creation of KPI based dashboards for understanding complex business issues to enable strategic and operational decision-making


Qualifications


Bachelor/Master’s degree in a related field (e.g. business administration, economics, statistics, mathematics)
2+ years of relevant experience in an e-commerce/ internet-based company
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel / Google Sheets
Solid experience writing SQL queries and with a knowledge of Tableau and Google Analytics
High affinity for numbers, unwavering attention to detail and a strong analytical mind


Additional Information


Your life-work balance and home office are part of our culture, you can work from home up to 5 days a week
Relocation support to Germany which includes visa assistance, apartment search and help with costs
Educational budget for your personal growth
Team and company events like Hackathons, International Nights, Company Party, Football and more
More than 90 different nationalities make up for a truly international and diverse working environment


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Kaltrina Lasku

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

Reporting into Head of Data Management you will deliver critical management information and analysis to allow our data managers identify data quality enhancements, monitor data usage and track supplier royalty costs. The quality of the analysis is of utmost importance, and decisions will be taken off the back of it. Alongside this you will directly manage a portfolio of data assets, with responsibility for the daily management including engaging with Product teams and the wider Experian UK&I business.

What You'll Do


End-to-End accountability for a nominated set of data assets throughout data lifecycle.
Maintain governance documentation (e.g. Record of Compliance, Data Handshakes) up to date.
Championing a culture that achieves goals, delights customers and keeps consumer advocacy at the heart of everything that Experian does.
Be the subject matter expert (SME) for your nominated data assets, supporting internal stakeholders looking for input, advice and granular detail.
Lead by example and follow all regulatory requirements and applying appropriate controls.
Support Data Owners with the curation of Management Information (MI) to ensure informed decisions around data usage, including trends and broader analysis.
Support regular MI requests for existing Data Office forums including Data Asset Reviews (DARs), Risk Management Meeting (RMG).
Ensure MI delivery is tested and validated to high level of accuracy.
Embrace your own curiosity around data, to highlight additional trends/insight to support better decisions.


Qualifications

What you'll bring:


Around 3 years of experience in a role which involves data management, manipulation or visualisation.
Experience with data manipulation tools such as SQL or Snowflake and/or data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI to create dashboards that bring the data to life.
Education degree in Data, Informatics, Mathematics, Statistics or similar.
Excellent written and verbal English.
Knowledge of activities, tasks, practices, deliverables and techniques for implementing enhanced data processing applications into a production environment, including knowledge of the data lifecycle stages.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

This is a hybrid remote/in-office role.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: DATA ANALYST F/H
Description:
Poste de contractuel à temps partiel - CDD de 2 ans renouvelable




Ministère de la Justice

35 rue de la Gare, 75019 Paris. Télétravail possible.

Présentiel obligatoire à Paris un jour par semaine (actuellement le mercredi) pour les réunions d’équipe




Tu aimes les données, la Justice et les nouveaux services numériques ? Tu veux mettre ton talent au service de l’intérêt général en aidant les tribunaux à réduire les délais pour les citoyens ?

Rejoins l'équipe A-JUST ! Au sein du Ministère de la Justice, la création de la direction de programme « Outils numériques de pilotage des juridictions » (DiP A-JUST) s’inscrit dans la trajectoire de pérennisation, au sein des services judiciaires, des outils d’aide à la décision et au pilotage des juridictions conçus par la start up d’Etat A-JUST.




Rattachée au directeur des services judiciaires, la direction de programme s’articule autour de 3 domaines d’action stratégique:




PRODUITS: la construction et la gestion en mode produits d’outils numériques dédiés au pilotage des juridictions
DATA: la valorisation des données de pilotage (activité et effectifs) présentes dans ces outils ou dans d’autres applicatifs, dans une logique de mutualisation opérationnelle
ACCOMPAGNEMENT: la formation et l’accompagnement à la transformation des pratiques de pilotage des équipes de direction par l’usage de ces produits numériques ainsi mis en cohérence.




La DiP A-JUST fonctionne selon la méthodologie des start up d’Etat:




équipe intégrant l’ensemble des compétences nécessaires à la construction, la gestion, le déploiement et la valorisation d’outils numériques, alliant compétences métier (fonctionnement des juridictions), techniques et d’accompagnement au changement.
application des principes généraux du « mode produit »: les utilisateurs et la résolution de leurs problèmes sont au centre de toute décision, les évolutions fonctionnent par boucles d'itérations rapides avec un droit à l'erreur, l'équipe est autonome dans les choix qui impactent le produit et pour interagir avec les utilisateurs (notamment, pas de séparation MOE/MOA, c’est-à-dire entre conception et réalisation) : elle est à ce titre redevable de son action auprès d’une gouvernance impliquant les utilisateurs.
respect de la finalité des produits en adéquation avec les enjeux de la politique prioritaire de réduction des délais de justice, pilotage par l’impact.




Composition de l'équipe




1 directeur de projet magistrat
1 coach/PO, responsable data
1 expert métier et outils (recrutement en cours)
1 directeur technique (recrutement en cours)
3 développeurs informatiques
1 UX designer
2 chargés de déploiement – support utilisateurs
1 data analyst en cours de recrutement: toi ?




Descriptif du poste




Le contrat : Emploi accessible aux personnes en situation de handicap. Rémunération envisagée entre 16 250 et 22 500€ bruts annuels pour un temps partiel, en fonction de l'expérience.




Ta mission : Tu contribueras au processus d’amélioration continue de la donnée opérationnelle de pilotage afin de permettre aux juridictions de disposer d’une vision la plus précise, récente et exploitable possible de leur activité. Tu travailleras à diversifier et fiabiliser les sources de données, en automatiser la collecte et accompagner les acteurs de terrain dans la compréhension, l’analyse et l’utilisation des données mises à leur disposition dans les outils de la DiP A-JUST afin de faciliter leurs prises de décisions, ainsi éclairées par l’impact.




Au quotidien, en lien avec le responsable data, la mission consiste à :

améliorer les algorithmes de pré-alimentation des outils du programme en données d’activité des juridictions
analyser les bases statistiques disponibles pour créer des requêtes permettant de collecter les données manquantes
œuvrer à la mise à disposition des juridictions de ces données pour une exploitation opérationnelle en conditions de pilotage
contribuer à l’amélioration des outils et modes de restitution de la donnée pour ses différents utilisateurs
échanger avec les juridictions et services data du ministère pour favoriser le partage, la compréhension, l’amélioration et l’exploitation des données disponibles.




Profil recherché

Connaissances

Gestion et requêtage de bases de données | Structuration de données | Construction d’algorithmes | Analyse logique pour requêter les bases de données selon les processus métier | Construction et analyses de tableaux de bord pour répondre à des besoins utilisateurs | La connaissance du fonctionnement des services judiciaires et/ou des services et outils de la statistique ministérielle serait un vrai plus.




Savoir-faire

Capacité d’analyse, en particulier de données chiffrées | Compréhension et analyse des outils et pratiques métier | Capacité de synthèse et qualités rédactionnelles | Capacité à documenter de façon pédagogique les opérations réalisées | Capacité à organiser sa charge de travail Souplesse dans la gestion des priorités




Savoir- être

Capacité à travailler en équipe – sens du collectif - gestion de la transversalité | Polyvalence et appétence pour des tâches diversifiées | Capacité d’adaptation à des interlocuteurs issus de milieux professionnels variés (membres de l’équipe) et de tous niveaux hiérarchiques (au sein des juridictions et des services ministériels) | Sens du relationnel et de la pédagogie | Ecoute | Capacité d’initiative/curiosité | Discrétion




Outils informatiques

Maîtrise des outils informatiques | Maîtrise avancée d’Excel | Connaissance des outils de gestion, partage et analyse de fichiers XML volumineux | Outils d’écriture d’algorithmes (YML) | Une aisance avec le langage SQL constituerait un atout | La connaissance de GRIST serait un plus.




Expérience souhaitée

Minimum 2 ans d’ancienneté dans un poste du secteur public ou privé ayant permis d’acquérir une expérience dans les domaines cités, notamment la compréhension des processus métier et la production ou l’analyse de données. (par ex. dans un service statistique ou de traitement et d’analyse de la donnée opérationnelle).




Pour postuler emploi@a-just.fr : envoyer un email avec ton CV, tes motivations, tes disponibilités et tout ce que tu voudras pour nous donner envie de te rencontrer. Nous nous engageons à te répondre avant fin mai en te proposant éventuellement un entretien.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
***Relocation opportunity to Germany***




Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Düsseldorf, Germany (Hybrid – 3 days a week)




We’re seeking a Data Analyst to join my client's dynamic Product team. In this role, you’ll analyze user behavior to generate insights, support A/B testing, and deliver actionable data to drive product enhancements.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze user behavior to generate actionable product insights
Support A/B testing from setup to analysis
Monitor data to identify trends, anomalies, and test outcomes
Deliver datasets to support data-driven features
Work on core product areas: search, homepage, filters, and map experience
Contribute to projects exploring AI tools, including AI-powered search features
Focused on improving product and user experience




Essential Skills:

Strong attitude and willingness to learn
Experience with R, Python, SQL, Hadoop, BigQuery
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience with A/B testing
Exposure to consumer-facing apps
Comfortable working with B2B tech products
At least 2 years of Data Analyst experience (open to more experience)




Benefits:

Personalized coaching, free online learning courses, and access to a fully equipped campus library
Relocation and visa support for Germany
25 days holiday
Flexible working hours
Daily canteen lunch, free drinks, and snacks
Health insurance, pension plan
Free on-campus gym and much more!




If you are interested and fit the bill, please apply today as we are scheduling interviews immediately.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging to drive meaningful insights and business decisions? Do you want to contribute to a company that helps individuals achieve their professional goals? If so, this role could be the perfect fit for you!




Your Role as a

As a , you will play a key role in shaping -driven strategies by analyzing complex sets and delivering actionable insights. Your work will directly impact product development, marketing strategies, and overall business performance. Additionally, you will help optimize internal processes and enhance platform efficiency through -driven solutions.




Key Responsibilities

base Optimization: Design and maintain scalable base structures for analytics and insights.
ETL Processes: Develop and manage ETL pipelines to integrate and transform from multiple sources.
Visualization: Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Studio to support business decision-making.
User Behavior Analysis: Analyze user engagement, cohort behaviors, and platform performance to improve the user experience.
Payment Analysis: Work with payment gateway (e.g., Stripe, PayPal) to monitor subscription trends and revenue performance.
Collaboration: Partner with cross-functional teams, including development, marketing, finance, and product, to meet needs.
Compliance: Ensure handling aligns with GDPR and other relevant regulations.




Who You Are

You are an analytical thinker with a keen eye for detail, capable of translating raw into meaningful insights. You enjoy working collaboratively but can also drive independent projects to completion. Adaptable and curious, you’re always eager to enhance your skills and contribute to a -driven culture.




Your Skills and Qualifications

Technical Skills:

Strong proficiency in and .
Experience with Studio, BigQuery, and other visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Hands-on experience with ETL tools like Apache Airflow, dbt, or Fivetran.
Familiarity with analytics platforms such as Google Analytics, Mixpanel, or Amplitude.
Experience in a SaaS environment




Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
3–5 years of experience in analysis, preferably within a SaaS or tech-driven environment.

Bonus Skills:

Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, or API integrations.
Understanding of career platforms and job seeker behavior analytics.




What’s Offered

A competitive salary based on experience.
25 annual leave days, including your birthday off.
A modern office space with on-site amenities such as a gym, game room, and social areas.
Comprehensive benefits, including meal provisions and transportation support.
A wellness budget to support gym memberships or personal hobbies.
Regular team activities, outings, and networking events.
Opportunities for professional development, including certifications in tools like Studio and BigQuery.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Somos Métrica, una consultora de negocio, integración de sistemas, servicios y soluciones IT, comprometida con la Sociedad de la información y el desarrollo tecnológico.

¿Te apasiona trabajar con datos, automatizar procesos y ser parte de proyectos que realmente aportan valor?

En Métrica estamos buscando a alguien como tú: curioso, con mentalidad analítica y muchas ganas de crecer. Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo un/a Data Analyst con entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia para colaborar en un proyecto puntero con un cliente referente en el sector.

Desde el primer día formarás parte de un entorno colaborativo donde tus ideas cuentan. Estarás acompañado por profesionales expertos que te guiarán y te ayudarán a potenciar tu carrera.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?

🔍 Experiencia en desarrollo de pipelines ETL con Apache Spark y Python.

☁️ Conocimiento práctico de servicios AWS como S3, RDS (PostgreSQL), IAM, Glue, EMR y Lambda.

🧠 Buen dominio de SQL.

🔧 Familiaridad con herramientas de control de versiones y flujos CI/CD.

⚡ Se valorará experiencia con procesamiento de datos en tiempo real.

📜 Certificaciones AWS en datos o arquitecturas cloud (deseable).

💹 Conocimientos en inversiones y banca privada (deseable).

🌍 Nivel de inglés intermedio o superior (deseable).

¿Qué te ofrecemos? 😎

📰 Contrato indefinido desde el inicio.

🏥 Acceso a un plan de retribución flexible.

👩‍🎓 Formación continua en las áreas que te interesen.

👨‍💻 Modalidad 100% remoto: trabaja desde donde estés.




En Métrica queremos ayudarte a dar el siguiente paso en tu carrera.

📧 ¡Contáctanos o envíanos tu CV!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d) – Mit Grundkenntnissen in der Luftfahrt




WePlan ist ein innovatives Unternehmen, das wegweisende Lösungen für die strategische und mehrjährige Personalplanung entwickelt. Mit unserem derzeitigen Kundenstamm in der Reise-, Transport- und Logistikbranche wachsen wir stetig und erweitern kontinuierlich unser Netzwerk. Dafür suchen wir motivierte Teamplayer, die mit uns gemeinsam die Zukunft gestalten möchten.




Deine Aufgaben:




Datenanalyse: Erstelle und pflege Dashboards sowie Berichte, um unseren Kunden datenbasierte Einblicke zu bieten
Optimierung: Analysiere komplexe Datenstrukturen und leite Handlungsempfehlungen zur Optimierung der Personalplanung ab
Entwicklung: Wirke bei der Entwicklung und Implementierung von Datenmodellen mit, die unsere Prozesse verbessern
Ad-hoc-Analysen: Unterstütze Entscheidungsprozesse durch die Durchführung spezifischer Datenanalysen
Zusammenarbeit: Arbeite eng mit verschiedenen Teams zusammen, um Datenbedürfnisse zu identifizieren und innovative Lösungen zu entwickeln




Dein Profil:




Akademischer Hintergrund: Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik oder einem ähnlichen Bereich
Praktische Erfahrung: Erste Kenntnisse im Bereich Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise mit Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI
Excel-Expertise: Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel, ergänzt durch SQL-Kenntnisse; Python oder R sind von Vorteil
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Ausgeprägtes analytisches Denkvermögen und eine strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Teamorientierung: Freude an der Zusammenarbeit in einem agilen und dynamischen Team




Was wir bieten:




Flexibles Arbeiten: Möglichkeit, überwiegend remote zu arbeiten (4 Tage pro Woche)
Zentrale Lage: Unser Büro befindet sich im Herzen von Frankfurt, mit Zugang zu Open Office Spaces in ganz Deutschland
Attraktive Vorteile: Genieße ein kostenloses Ticket für den öffentlichen Nahverkehr, kostenlose Getränke und exklusive Catering-Angebote
Top-Ausstattung: Wir stellen die neueste Apple-Hardware bereit und bieten zahlreiche Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung




Bewirb dich jetzt!




Wenn du Teil eines innovativen Teams werden und zur Entwicklung wegweisender Lösungen beitragen möchtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

YOUR ROLE


Understand company requirements and define KPIs for dashboard development.
Collect, clean, and transform datasets using ETL tools to create effective data models.
Develop and maintain dashboards for operational risk management.
Ensure agility in updating dashboards according to stakeholders' needs.
Continuously improve dashboard accuracy and usability by monitoring data quality.
Present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Make recommendations to enhance dashboard production and data-driven decision-making.
Promote a data-driven culture within CIB by developing new data models.


YOUR PROFILE


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.Experience as a Data Analyst, specializing in dashboard development.
Proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, Cognos, SQL, and ETL tools.
Experience with DataIKU.
Basic Python skills, preferably with Pandas.
Strong understanding of data visualization techniques.
Experience in Big Data technologies (PySpark, Presto, Airflow).
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX.
Familiarity with descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing.


What You'll Love About Working Here


At Capgemini Portugal we have a flexible and dynamic work environment. Flexibility enables a better work-life balance and gives more flexibility to the employee to manage the working hours, as well if he works at the office or remotely, according with the company’s hybrid work policy;
We have local programs that promote people growth, reskill and new skills development (Career Acceleration Programs);
We promote an empowering environment with autonomy and peers' relationships among the top scores of our Monthly Employees' feedback;
Next to this, we also offer an attractive compensation package and benefits such as Health and Life insurance, as well as Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations and other fringe benefits according with our partnerships in force.
Capgemini Portugal is an equal opportunity employer. We promote equality and dignity in all aspects of recruitment and employment, as well as employment offers and promotions made according with competence and ability or performance, respectively.


About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get the future you want | www.capgemini.com

Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's and/or master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar;
At least 2 years as a data analyst
Experience with Python, PySpark and airflow;
Comfortable with Oracle DB, Data warehouse;
Fluent in English;
Good communication and interpersonal skills;
Be already in Portugal legally, available to do a hybrid model in Lisbon.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been electedWe believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.




At KCS IT, we stand for equality and value diversity. We foster a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

All applications with the required skills for the position are welcome!

Title: Analista dati
Description:
Azienda & Valori:

Il nostro cliente è una multinazionale leader nel settore oil & gas, con una presenza consolidata a livello globale. La sede italiana, situata in Milano, zona centrale, è il cuore delle operazioni commerciali e amministrative del gruppo per l'Europa. L'azienda promuove un ambiente di lavoro dinamico, innovativo e inclusivo, con un forte focus sulla crescita e lo sviluppo delle competenze dei propri dipendenti.




Titolo della posizione:

Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale (M/F/D)




Finalità del Ruolo:

Il Data Entry & Analysis Commerciale avrà la responsabilità di gestire l’inserimento e la validazione dei dati commerciali e di supportare l’analisi dei dati per il monitoraggio delle performance aziendali. Il candidato sarà il punto di riferimento per la gestione delle informazioni legate ai dati di vendita e ai report commerciali, lavorando a stretto contatto con il team vendite e l’area finance. Sarà cruciale l’abilità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight utili per ottimizzare le strategie commerciali.




Tasks:

• Inserire, validare e aggiornare i dati relativi alle vendite e ai clienti all'interno del sistema gestionale aziendale, garantendo accuratezza e tempestività.

• Utilizzare Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato, con una solida padronanza di tabelle pivot, funzioni avanzate e macro per l’analisi e l’elaborazione dei dati.

• Creare e aggiornare report commerciali periodici, monitorando le performance di vendita, il raggiungimento degli obiettivi e i KPI.

• Collaborare con il team commerciale per l’analisi delle previsioni di vendita e l’andamento dei mercati, supportando la definizione di strategie di miglioramento.

• Identificare anomalie o discrepanze nei dati, proponendo soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza del processo di data entry e di analisi.

• Supportare il team nella gestione di grandi volumi di dati, provenienti da diverse fonti, e nella loro integrazione in report consolidati.

• Partecipare alla creazione di dashboard interattive utilizzando strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI o Tableau, per fornire visualizzazioni intuitive e dinamiche delle informazioni aziendali.

• Fornire insight utili e proposte basate sui dati per ottimizzare le strategie di vendita e migliorare l’efficienza operativa.




Relazioni funzionali:

Interne: Collaborazione diretta con il team vendite, l'area finance e il reparto IT per la gestione dei dati e dei flussi di informazioni.
Esterne: Occasionali interazioni con partner esterni o fornitori di software per l'integrazione di nuove soluzioni di analisi e data entry.




Funzioni Primarie:

• Inserimento, gestione e validazione dei dati commerciali.

• Creazione e aggiornamento di report commerciali e analisi delle performance di vendita.

• Collaborazione con il team vendite per l’ottimizzazione delle strategie commerciali.

• Utilizzo avanzato di Excel, con particolare focus su tabelle pivot, macro e funzioni avanzate.

• Utilizzo di strumenti di business intelligence per la creazione di dashboard e visualizzazioni dati.




Formazione e Competenze:

Il candidato ideale possiede una Laurea in Data Analytics, Statistica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini. È richiesta una solida esperienza nell’uso di Microsoft Excel a livello avanzato e di strumenti di data analysis. La familiarità con strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti costituisce un plus, così come l’esperienza nella gestione di dati in contesti aziendali complessi.




Hard Skills:

• Competenze avanzate nell'uso di Microsoft Excel (tabelle pivot, macro, funzioni avanzate).

• Capacità di analizzare grandi quantità di dati e fornire insight strategici.

• Esperienza nella creazione di report commerciali e nella gestione dei KPI.

• Conoscenza di strumenti di business intelligence come Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.

• Competenze nel data entry e nella validazione dei dati.

• Esperienza nell’automazione dei processi di analisi e reporting.




Soft Skills:

• Eccellenti capacità di analisi e problem-solving.

• Precisione e attenzione ai dettagli nella gestione dei dati.

• Ottime capacità di collaborazione e comunicazione con team interni.

• Proattività nel migliorare processi e flussi di lavoro.

• Flessibilità e capacità di adattamento in un ambiente dinamico e in costante evoluzione.




Cosa Offre il nostro Committente:

L'azienda offre un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e un ambiente di lavoro flessibile e innovativo:

• RAL fino a 35.000€: La retribuzione annua lorda massima prevista è di 35.000€, commisurata all’esperienza del candidato.

• Smart Working 2 giorni a settimana: Possibilità di lavorare in modalità ibrida, garantendo un equilibrio tra vita privata e lavorativa.

• Assicurazione Sanitaria Fondo Est: Copertura sanitaria estesa per il benessere del dipendente.

• Ticket Restaurant: Buoni pasto giornalieri da 9€ per ogni giorno lavorato.

• Accesso al welfare aziendale: Iniziative e programmi di welfare volti a migliorare la qualità della vita lavorativa.

• Formazione Continua: Opportunità di crescita e aggiornamento delle competenze, con accesso a percorsi di formazione e sviluppo professionale.




L'offerta è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, nonché a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

I dati personali saranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (GDPR) e della normativa nazionale vigente in materia di protezione dei dati personali. Il trattamento dei dati avverrà con modalità e strumenti idonei a garantire la riservatezza e la sicurezza degli stessi, secondo le finalità indicate nell’informativa privacy che sarà fornita ai candidati. Inviando il proprio curriculum vitae, il candidato autorizza espressamente il trattamento dei dati ai sensi della suddetta normativa e dichiara di aver preso visione dell’informativa sulla privacy.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Randstad Digital is at the forefront of transforming the digital landscape, committed to delivering exceptional outcomes for our clients' businesses and their customers. With over 25,000 engineers and digital experts worldwide, we specialize in accelerating digital enablement across various industries. Join us and be part of a talent-first organization.







We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join our team to work on a cloud-based platform that simplifies the subscription of digital services for fleets. This platform offers comprehensive solutions for fleet management, including real-time vehicle position tracking, cruising speed updates, and driving parameter analytics to calculate driver performance and identify vehicle performance patterns.







Responsibilities:

Conduct data analysis on large datasets, including necessary cleaning and preparation steps.
Apply statistical methods such as descriptive statistics, data profiling, and validation.
Explore data to identify patterns, relationships, anomalies, and trends.
Analyze and break down complex problems into manageable parts and actionable insights.
Use logic and reasoning to draw meaningful conclusions from data.
Prepare and deliver presentations to effectively communicate complex ideas and results.
Collaborate cross-functionally with different teams to ensure insights align with team strategies.
Share findings and methodologies openly to support team members and the broader organization.
Document data quality issues and provide actionable recommendations.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into analytical solutions.




Qualifications:




5 to 7 years of experience
Proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
Knowledge of Python or other programming languages used in data analysis.
Familiarity with data quality dimensions and best practices.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Hands-on experience with big data technologies, for example, PySpark and distributed storage/processing systems.
Familiarity with ETL tools and building data pipelines.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and services (AWS experience is a plus).

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stokke – Here We Grow:

With over eight decades of history, Stokke was founded on Norway’s west coast in 1932. Deeply rooted in Scandinavian heritage, our brand is built on principles of quality, craftsmanship, and family connection. For more than 40 years, Stokke has delivered iconic and innovative solutions for children—products that are not only beautifully designed but made to nurture family bonding and support child development.

With global offices in Norway, The Netherlands, the U.S., Germany, France, and Asia, Stokke offers a truly international work environment, committed to shaping a better world through confident kids.







Take Responsibility – The Position:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Global E-Commerce team. This role is key to unlocking the power of data across our e-commerce operations. You will analyze and interpret data from multiple sources, design and maintain interactive dashboards using Power BI, and generate insights that support data-driven decision-making

.You will also play a central role in data governance and drive the continuous improvement of data usage and visualization across teams. With a digital-first focus, you will help track and analyze website user behavior, contributing to optimizations that enhance the online customer experience and drive growth.




Key Responsibilities:

Data Analysis & Visualization

Analyze large datasets from various digital and business sources to derive strategic and operational insights
Design, develop, and maintain Power BI dashboards for internal stakeholders
Create reporting frameworks and data models that support business decision-making




Digital Analytics & Web Tracking

Collaborate with eCommerce and digital marketing teams to track and interpret website and user behavior
Provide recommendations for website optimization based on behavioral and performance data
Support tagging and tracking implementation across digital platforms




Data Governance & Quality Assurance

Support the implementation and enforcement of data governance standards
Conduct data quality checks to ensure the accuracy and reliability of insights
Troubleshoot data issues in collaboration with IT and development teams




Cross-Functional Collaboration

Partner with global and regional teams in eCommerce, Marketing, and IT to support data needs
Present findings in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Help build a data-driven culture through education and knowledge sharing




Better Together: The Ideal Profile:

Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Economics, Business Administration, Mathematics, IT, or a related field
3–4 years of relevant experience, preferably in the eCommerce industry
Proficiency in Power BI and the ability to create engaging, insight-driven dashboards
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, business modeling, and economics
Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken)
Experience working in interdisciplinary and international teams is an advantage
Analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights
Strong sense of ownership and autonomy in problem-solving
A passion for continuous improvement and cross-functional collaboration
Ability to manage multiple data sources and ensure consistency and accuracy in reporting




Keep Growing – What We Offer:

A chance to work with a globally recognized premium brand with a strong mission and purpose
A dynamic, hybrid international work environment located in Amsterdam
Exposure to cutting-edge digital analytics platforms and tools
The opportunity to help shape the future of Stokke’s eCommerce and digital performance strategy
A collaborative culture that supports continuous learning, development, and innovation
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Would you like to build a career in a leading multinational IT company?

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team.

Since 2007, MMDSmart has been a leading supplier in cloud communications, delivering game-changing IT products to businesses in over 100 countries. Our success is fueled by the inspiration and innovative ideas of our team members, encouraging their growth and impacting our Messaging and Voice solutions. These empower our clients to communicate more effectively with their customers. Don't miss this chance to excel in a rapidly expanding tech company, where your potential and ambitions are not just recognized, but celebrated.

Requirements

What will you do at MMDSmart?

  • Develop and support analytical systems for operational analysis and decision making;
  • Communicate with Business Process Owners, identifying KPIs;
  • Communicate with development teams to identify data sources, data lifecycle analysis;
  • Developing the data storage structure in DWH, setting requirements for the Data;
  • Engineer about the ETL process, and checking the results;
  • Developing dashboards in analytical platforms;
  • Presenting analytical results to customers.


You are a perfect match if you have:

  • 1+ years of experience as Data/Product/Business/BI analyst;
  • Understanding the principles of business process analysis, KPI identification;
  • 1+ years of experience in DataViz platforms: Tableau/Looker/SuperSet;
  • Knowledge of programming: SQL, Python +, database principles;
  • An analytical mind, communication and presentation skills, and teamwork skills;
  • Fluent Russian.


Benefits

Why do talents choose and stay at MMDSmart?

Embrace the opportunity to work in a company that cares about:

Your Wellness: Access to mental health programs, comprehensive medical insurance, and a sports card*.

Your Happiness: Enjoy the company of cool teammates, a friendly atmosphere, a strong mentorship, and a variety of bonuses & corporate gifts.

Your Development: Benefit from free educational events & courses, and English classes with native speakers.

Your Career: Focus on your professional development in a supportive environment.

Work-Life Balance: Choose your working format - remote, office-based, or hybrid and engage in team-building activities.

Think this role's got your name on it? Go ahead and apply, we'd love to see what you've got!

Equal-Opportunity Employment

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

  • Medical Insurance and Sport Card perks are available for employees located in Bulgaria

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

Show more
